applist.name: God of War
applist.detailed_description:
Enter the Norse realm
His vengeance against the Gods of Olympus years behind him, Kratos now lives as a man in the realm of Norse Gods and monsters. It is in this harsh, unforgiving world that he must fight to survive… and teach his son to do the same.

Grasp a second chance
Kratos is a father again. As mentor and protector to Atreus, a son determined to earn his respect, he is forced to deal with and control the rage that has long defined him while out in a very dangerous world with his son.

Journey to a dark, elemental world of fearsome creatures
From the marble and columns of ornate Olympus to the gritty forests, mountains and caves of pre-Viking Norse lore, this is a distinctly new realm with its own pantheon of creatures, monsters and gods.

Engage in visceral, physical combat
With an over the shoulder camera that brings the player closer to the action than ever before, fights in God of War™ mirror the pantheon of Norse creatures Kratos will face: grand, gritty and grueling. A new main weapon and new abilities retain the defining spirit of the God of War series while presenting a vision of conflict that forges new ground in the genre.

PC FEATURES


High Fidelity Graphics
Striking visuals enhanced on PC. Enjoy true 4K resolution, on supported devices, [MU1] with unlocked framerates for peak performance. Dial in your settings via a wide range of graphical presets and options including higher resolution shadows, improved screen space reflections, the addition of GTAO and SSDO, and much more.

NVIDIA® DLSS and Reflex Support
Quality meets performance. Harness the AI power of NVIDIA Deep Learning Super Sampling (DLSS) to boost frame rates and generate beautiful, sharp images on select Nvidia GPUs. Utilize NVIDIA Reflex low latency technology allowing you to react quicker and hit harder combos with the responsive gameplay you crave on GeForce GPUs.

Controls Customization
Play your way. With support for the DUALSHOCK®4 and DUALSENSE® wireless controllers, a wide range of other gamepads, and fully customizable bindings for mouse and keyboard, you have the power to fine-tune every action to match your playstyle.

Ultra-wide Support
Immerse yourself like never before. Journey through the Norse realms taking in breathtaking vistas in panoramic widescreen. With 21:9 ultra-widescreen support, God of War™ presents a cinema quality experience that further expands the original seamless theatrical vision.

Gameplay consists of frequent combat scenarios with characters punching and kicking or using their axe to slash/stab/impale enemies. Some larger enemies  are opened up to intense finishing moves showing enemies being ripped apart, dismembered, or decapitated.

Strong Language is used in the dialogue.

reviews.review: Kratos taught me so much more things than my actual father. 10/10
I shouldn't purchased and played the whole game, now my soul is strongly demanding a PS5 and God of War Ragnarök right now.

Do not be sorry. Be better.

Do not mistake my silence for lack of grief.

Anger can be a weapon. If you can control it, use it.

There are no "good" gods, boy. Thought I taught you that.

The road ahead is no place for a boy, you must be a warrior.

The gods care nothing for them. Men should not pray to monsters.

Keep your expectations low, boy, and you will never be disappointed.

Fate is another lie told by the gods. Nothing is written that cannot be unwritten.

Close your heart to their desperation. Close your heart to their suffering. Do not allow yourself to feel for them. They will not feel for you.
Second playthrough of this game now on pc and is still amazing. Release Ragnarok pls

I am definitely late to the party - this game has been out for a while now.. But I'll be damned if it doesn't hold up in every way possible! As a long time fan of the franchise, I've been waiting to see how things have changed.. And they have changed a lot (compared to GoW I, II & III). This game moves GoW from the classic "idk, I'm stronk, hack 'n slash everyone" to more of a "wait hang on, I need to take some time here" contemplative challenge. The challenges presented are the right level of difficulty to be truly rewarding when completed. 
I just have to say, as a final note... Go. W has always captured my heart in terms of the story telling aspect, and this instalment has given me the strongest emotional reaction that I've had playing through this franchise to date.
Somehow, you (Santa Monica Studios) have made me fall in love all over again. Mad props to literally EVERY SINGLE SOUL on the production team. 
Love it.

An AI definitely did not write the below review:

God of War is an absolute triumph in the world of video games. From the moment I picked up the controller, I was transported into an epic adventure unlike anything I had ever experienced. This game is a true masterpiece that raises the bar for storytelling, gameplay mechanics, and visual excellence.

First and foremost, the narrative in God of War is an awe-inspiring achievement. The game takes us on a journey with Kratos, the Spartan warrior, as he navigates the realms of Norse mythology alongside his son, Atreus. The father-son dynamic is beautifully crafted, and their evolving relationship adds a depth of emotion and vulnerability rarely seen in video games. The writing is impeccable, weaving a rich tapestry of tragedy, growth, and redemption that will keep you emotionally invested from start to finish.

The gameplay mechanics are flawless and finely tuned to perfection. Combat in God of War is intense, satisfying, and deeply strategic. Kratos wields his Leviathan Axe with unparalleled precision, while Atreus provides invaluable support with his archery skills. The seamless integration of cinematic moments into gameplay adds to the immersion, making every battle a breathtaking spectacle.

The world of God of War is a stunning work of art. The attention to detail in the environments, character designs, and mythical creatures is jaw-dropping. Exploring the realms of Norse mythology feels authentic and immersive, with each area offering unique challenges and secrets waiting to be discovered. The game seamlessly blends the epic scale of its world with intimate character-driven moments, creating a balanced and cohesive experience.

Furthermore, the musical score deserves special mention. The hauntingly beautiful compositions perfectly complement the narrative and evoke a wide range of emotions. The music swells with grandeur during epic battles, and delicately underscores the quieter, introspective moments, leaving a lasting impression on players.

God of War is a shining example of what video games can achieve as an art form. It pushes boundaries, challenges conventions, and raises the bar for storytelling and gameplay. With its breathtaking visuals, emotionally charged narrative, and meticulously crafted gameplay mechanics, it has set a new standard that will be remembered for years to come.

In conclusion, God of War is an absolute triumph. It delivers a captivating story, engaging gameplay, and a visually stunning world, all while exploring themes of family, sacrifice, and the consequences of one's actions. This game deserves every bit of praise it has received and more. It is a true testament to the power of video games as a medium, and an experience that no player should miss.

applist.name: MONSTER HUNTER RISE
applist.detailed_description:
Featured DLC

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1880360/Monster_Hunter_Rise_Sunbreak/
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1913711/Monster_Hunter_Rise_Sunbreak_Deluxe_Kit/
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1748411/MONSTER_HUNTER_RISE_Deluxe_Kit/
















About the Game

Rise to the challenge and join the hunt! In Monster Hunter Rise, the latest installment in the award-winning and top-selling Monster Hunter series, you’ll become a hunter, explore brand new maps and use a variety of weapons to take down fearsome monsters as part of an all-new storyline. The PC release also comes packed with a number of additional visual and performance enhancing optimizations.


Ferocious monsters with unique ecologies
Hunt down a plethora of monsters with distinct behaviors and deadly ferocity. From classic returning monsters to all-new creatures inspired by Japanese folklore, including the flagship wyvern Magnamalo, you’ll need to think on your feet and master their unique tendencies if you hope to reap any of the rewards!


Choose your weapon and show your skills
Wield 14 different weapon types that offer unique gameplay styles, both up-close and from long range. Charge up and hit hard with the devastating Great Sword; dispatch monsters in style using the elegant Long Sword; become a deadly maelstrom of blades with the speedy Dual Blades; charge forth with the punishing Lance; or take aim from a distance with the Bow and Bowguns. These are just a few of the weapon types available in the game, meaning you’re sure to find the play style that suits you best.


Hunt, gather and craft your way to the top of the food chain
Each monster you hunt will provide materials that allow you to craft new weapons and armor and upgrade your existing gear. Go back out on the field and hunt even fiercer monsters and earn even better rewards! You can change your weapon at any of the Equipment Boxes any time, so the possibilities are limitless!


Hunt solo or team up to take monsters down
The Hunter Hub offers multiplayer quests where up to four players can team up to take on targets together. Difficulty scaling ensures that whether you go solo or hit the hunt as a full four-person squad, it’s always a fair fight.


Stunning visuals, unlocked framerate and other PC optimizations
Enjoy beautiful graphics at up 4K resolution, HDR with support for features including ultrawide monitors and an unlocked frame rate make to make this a truly immersive monster-hunting experience. Hunters will also get immediate access to a number of free title updates that include new monsters, quests, gear and more.


Enjoy an exciting new storyline set in Kamura Village
This serene locale is inhabited by a colorful cast of villagers who have long lived in fear of the Rampage - a catastrophic event where countless monsters attack the village all at once. 50 years after the last Rampage, you must work together with the villagers to face this trial.


Experience new hunting actions with the Wirebug
Wirebugs are an integral part of your hunter’s toolkit. The special silk they shoot out can be used to zip up walls and across maps, and can even be used to pull off special attacks unique to each of the 14 weapon types in the game.


Buddies are here to help
The Palico Felyne friends you already know and love from previous Monster Hunter adventures are joined by the brand new Palamute Canyne companions!


Wreak havoc by controlling monsters
Control raging monsters using Wyvern Riding and dish out massive damage to your targets!


Fend off hordes of monsters in The Rampage
Protect Kamura Village from hordes of monsters in an all-new quest type! Prepare for monster hunting on a scale like never before!

reviews.review:
TL;DR - A great game, but it has both good and bad decisions. Solid 7.5 - 8 / 10. Feels like an Arcade version of Monster Hunter.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This is the MOST grindy Monster Hunter game I have played, only bested by the JP only MMO Monster Hunter Frontier.

However, there's a lot of cool ideas and there is still a lot of fun to be had. Such as the vertical movement, special attacks and if you get the Sunbreak Expansion, new basic combos for each weapon to change up your normal gameplay.

The mobility is awesome with both player movement and the new dog companion being a mount. The weapons feel slick and fast. Monsters are much more active and can be incredibly aggressive now.

Combat feels awesome, especially when fighting regular monsters. Hits have good weight, each weapon has many options and it's a ton of fun to land some counterattack, or a big move and have the monster stumble and fall to your mighty blow. Or maybe you tapped it with your hand and it collapsed, either way the gameplay is still as solid as ever in any Monster Hunter Title.

On one hand, they're now more engaging, but on the other hand a lot of the monsters individual personalities feel lost. 

If you're not a completionist, the game should give you about 60-100 hours with friends easily. If you're alone, your gameplay time may vary.

The endgame in Rise is mostly just fighting the same monsters you've already been fighting, but they have a titanic health pool instead of a normal one, and they hit REALLY hard. You're grinding for a specific material that only drops off this special version, but only about 2 or 3 each hunt. Then, once you grind that same monster enough, it gets stronger and now drops that same item, but STRONGER, and you have to grind that item too. It gets insanely repetitive and boring.

After 100%-ing the game with my wife, I uh...I have a final statement.

I have finally earned my freedom.

Many monsters think they can outsmart me with combos and stuns.

Maybe.

But i am yet to find monster than can outsmart normal ammo 2.
gore magala is my son he has (one) disease and is also wanted in 37 countries for violating the geneva convention

I just saw an idiot say the game is bad because all you do is hunt monsters and use the materials from the monsters to craft armor and weapons so you can hunt more monsters….yes you dumbass, the game is called MONSTER HUNTER, that’s how it’s always been, it’s fine if you don’t like the game but just because you don’t like it doesn’t mean it’s bad. It’s a simple concept that’s been used since the first monster hunter game and I think people don’t realize that games can have simple concepts and still be fun. You hunt monsters, you keep hunting monsters, it’s fun. The gameplay is easy but hard to master, love using the charge blade. My only gripe about this game is going from a magnificent feast from monster hunter world…..to just three sticks of dango and a cup of tea, and I get it, it’s a Japanese setting but they could’ve done some yakisona, takoyaki, onigiri and sake. Anyways the game is 10/10 and I thought a lot of the formula and features in world were useless so it’s nice seeing the game going back to the basics without the tracking quests just to report back just so the next time you go out you can actually fight the monster

Granted it's not the same as MH:World formula, but it redeem itself by adding tons of this new 'switch skills' move that can alter some weapon playstyle and combos. Not forget to mention you can fast travel around the Hub and skip the cutscene (thank god). There is no requirement for 'You can only join the quest after the leader watched all cutscenes' anymore.
My only a little bit of complaint is how multiplayer works, instead of you can search the quest thats been requested SoS from (MH:World), you search based on target monster or which quest you want to join. So it's impossible to look at list of quest on quest board like in previous iteration.
Great game if you've never played Monster Hunter. World is still a better game, but this is still an easy recommend.

applist.name: Resident Evil 3
applist.detailed_description:
Resident Evil 3: Raccoon City Demo


About the Game

Jill Valentine is one of the last remaining people in Raccoon City to witness the atrocities Umbrella performed. To stop her, Umbrella unleashes their ultimate secret weapon; Nemesis!

Also includes Resident Evil Resistance, a new 1 vs 4 online multiplayer game set in the Resident Evil universe where four survivors face-off against a sinister Mastermind.

If you don't have enough graphics memory to run the game at your selected texture quality, you must go to Options > Graphics and lower the texture quality or shadow quality, or decrease the resolution. Pretty much every change they made here is a downgrade, and clueless fans of this will say "lul your just a hater bruh"
They did Jill really dirty here, she went from intelligent, nice, but very tough and will kick your ass in a heartbeat kind of girl; To a cynical, sarcastic, and annoying jarhead stereotype. Resident Evil 3: Nemesis is a survival horror game developed by Capcom and originally released in 1999 for the PlayStation. The game received a remake in 2020, which I will be reviewing below.

The game follows Jill Valentine, a member of the Raccoon City police department, as she tries to escape the city during a zombie outbreak. She is pursued by a powerful bioweapon called Nemesis, who is sent to eliminate all S.T.A.R.S. members.

The 2020 remake of Resident Evil 3 features updated graphics and gameplay mechanics, but it also makes some changes to the original game. The biggest change is the removal of certain areas and events, which makes the game shorter than its predecessor.

In terms of gameplay, Resident Evil 3 is a mix of action and survival horror. The game features a dodge mechanic that allows players to avoid enemy attacks and counterattack. 

Compared to other games in the series, Resident Evil 3 is generally considered to be less successful than its predecessor, Resident Evil 2. The game received criticism for its shorter length and the removal of certain areas and events from the original game. However, the updated graphics and gameplay mechanics received praise from critics and fans.

Overall, Resident Evil 3 is a solid survival horror game that is worth playing for fans of the genre. However, those who are looking for a longer and more complex game may prefer some of the other games in the series.

Тот случай, когда порекомендую сначала пройти ремейк этой части, нежели после прохождения второго. Дело в том, что на контрасте со вторым ремейком, третий выглядит и играется довольно посредственно и уступает по многим параметрам. Начиная от отсутствия в прежней мере экономить патроны, из-за чего игра превратилась больше в экшен-шутер, нежели сурвайвор, до потешного Немезиса, который вселяет больше смех, чем ужас. Так же игра страдает скудной продолжительностью. И это удивительно, ведь если бы разрабы больше уделили внимания оригиналу, то всего этого можно было избежать. Классику я прошел следом, чтобы понять из-за чего негодовали олды, пройдя ремейк. После чего их негодование стало для меня доходчиво. В ремейке по какой-то причине отсутствует часть локаций и множество головоломок из оригинала, которые могли с легкостью разбавить тон геймплея. Так же в оригинале была малая нелинейность, когда в определенные моменты прохождения застывало время, и можно было выбрать одно из двух действий, которое не кардинально, но меняло исход ситуации. Мне показалось это интересной механикой, которую стоило развить. Хорошо, что хоть додж от поступающих атак оставили. В общем, описанные выше пункты могли стереть самую главную проблему ремейка на мой взгляд. 

В целом же графика и оптимизация на уровне. Персонажи играют и выглядят достойно. Стрельба приятная. Саундтрек неплохой. Игра сохранила некую часть формулы ремейка второй части, но опять же, в сравнении с ним, третий кажется слабым и пустым. Потерянный потенциал. Короткий хронометраж. Упор на зрелищность, экшен для сохранения динамики в геймплее. Отсутствие головоломок и части локаций из оригинала. Комичный Немезис, который к тому же появляется исключительно в рамках скриптовых моментов. Некоторые боссфайты с ним это что-то с чем-то. Пройти все же стоит, но еще раз, настоятельно рекомендую проходить до второго ремейка, чтобы впечатления были слегка ярче из-за неимения на бэкграунде почвы для сравнения. Лорно никакой путаницы для Вас не будет, т.к. события двух ремейков протекают в плюс-минус одно время.

Хорошая игра, но спорный ремейк

Оригинал был для меня одной из знаковых игр в свое время которую я проходил несколько раз. После превосходного ремейка второй части на тройку возлагали огромные надежды, но, как оказалось, напрасно. Может из-за того, что обе игры разрабатывались практически параллельно, может из-за того что разрабы просто спешили, может они просто не угадали с вектором - игру они порезали в местах, где фанаты им не простили. Отчасти я с ними согласен. Не потому что считаю что переносить 100% оригинальных локаций, врагов, боссов, загадок было бы хорошей идеей. А потому что то, что сделано, выглядит как огрызок от игры, которая задумывалась больше, чем она получилась в итоге. Уровень в канализации и уровнем-то назвать сложно, два коридора. 

Что получилось хорошо: помимо, очевидно, технической составляющей, игре прекрасно удалось донести динамику первоисточника, ее идею, на мой взгляд она даже лучше с этим справилась, чем оригинал. Стрельба сочная, есть увороты/уклонения, Немезис дышит в спину и не дает спуску. Загадки убрали да и хрен бы с ними, это атавизм, который только мешает в боевике. 

Чего я не могу понять и простить так это ценника. Извините, но такое продавать за 60$ на старте - это кощунство. Мало того что игра короткая сама по себе, она в целом ощущается как длц/спинофф, так в нее никаких режимов не добавили, реиграбельность нулевая. Наемники, напомню, были даже в оригинале. Не удивительно что здесь довольно много охотников за ачивками, люди буквально каждый цент стараются выбить. 

Если брать для коллекции и не расчесывать фантомные воспоминания об оригинале - рекомендую

[h1] Review[/h1] 
The original RE3 was great. I really liked it. It was more linear than 1 and 2 but I felt much more dread due to the nemesis being able to appear on a lot of places I didn’t expect and also was able to follow you through doors. It shattered my expectation of the game. Boss fights were mechanically more interesting although the aiming and dodge system were rather broken. I was hyped up for this one as it seemed a game that could be way much better with a remake unlike RE2 which was already really good.

[u]Gameplay[/u]
There is solely two changes in the combat. Defence items got removed, meaning your knife is now unbreakable thus you have to carry it all the time in a no item box run, and the dodge move from RE3 original is back. This time it works very well and considering how the nemesis moves a welcome addition. Although one that makes the game a bit too easy. Combat is much more action focused as is the whole game. It reminds me more of RE6 which I unironically liked. But is that really the route they want to go again?

There are more difficulties aside veteran, two more you unlock but those tend to also be easy due to the possibility to buy an infinite AR in the points shop after a playthrough or two. You get points for doing challenges.

I must say that I enjoyed the main campaign a lot even though it definitely lacked in a lot of content in areas and became quickly more and more linear. The first area is great where you probably spend an hour or so. After that I was surprised what kind of content they added. Some throwback to RE2 and some scenes where you play as Carlos and run and gun with an assault rifle.

The main focus is the nemesis but he is an overall less scary version of the one from the original. He’s very predictable here and later on its more just running away from him in a corridor. Its still fun and impressive but the game has such an incredible start gameplay wise. Spectacle wise it stays strong until the end of the game, especially the last boss fight was visually great.

Now the elephant in the room. It lacks content. A lot of it. The first hour is quite faithful while adding a lot of content. After the train ride it’s the opposite. A lot of scenes are scrapped, including the last are, the clocktower, cemetery etc. My first playthrough took me just over 4-5 hours, the second less than 2. My fastest time was around 1 hour and 25 minutes and I’m not a speedrunner. It’s a really short game. A single run in RE2 will take you longer not to mention the Claire/Leon A and B route. Barely any puzzles and not much new. At least you don’t have that awful acid shower battle in the game anymore!

[u]Story[/u]
You start off a section as Jill where you get glimpses of her life and what she is up to due to Umbrellas workings. Until you’re suddenly amidst the Zombie outbreak and the Nemesis chases you in a very cool although heavily scripted sequence.

[u]Sound[/u]
I really like the new ost, it’s a more complex version of some tracks of the original. Although I prefer the raw dread the original nemesis theme presented. Again, game is available in a lot of voiced languages! Always like this commitment.

[u]Graphics[/u]
Not much changed from RE2 although the texture models of the characters are much better! There are also a lot more visually interesting places especially the chaos from the outbreak in the start of the game.

[u]Conclusion/TL;DR[/u]
I really enjoyed my short playthrough of this game. But considering it as a remake it doesn’t add enough to justify the content they cut. Especially since places like the clocktower museum which was my favourite are missing! Unlike RE2 remake it doesn’t stay that faithful while adding more content but rather just does this in the first half of the game. After that it gets much more linear and solely became a rather fun action focused game. Could have expanded and improved the content RE3 had and it would have made my favourite RE title. Still worth looking into as the game is still an enjoyable rollercoaster ride.

applist.name: Red Dead Redemption 2
applist.detailed_description:
Ultimate Edition


The Red Dead Redemption 2: Ultimate Edition delivers all of the Story Mode content from the Special Edition plus additional content for online including Bonus Outfits for your online Character, Rank Bonuses, Black Chestnut Thoroughbred and free access to the Survivor Camp Theme.

Plus get free access to Additional Weapons in online.


About the Game

America, 1899.

Arthur Morgan and the Van der Linde gang are outlaws on the run. With federal agents and the best bounty hunters in the nation massing on their heels, the gang must rob, steal and fight their way across the rugged heartland of America in order to survive. As deepening internal divisions threaten to tear the gang apart, Arthur must make a choice between his own ideals and loyalty to the gang who raised him.

Now featuring additional Story Mode content and a fully-featured Photo Mode, Red Dead Redemption 2 also includes free access to the shared living world of Red Dead Online, where players take on an array of roles to carve their own unique path on the frontier as they track wanted criminals as a Bounty Hunter, create a business as a Trader, unearth exotic treasures as a Collector or run an underground distillery as a Moonshiner and much more.

With all new graphical and technical enhancements for deeper immersion, Red Dead Redemption 2 for PC takes full advantage of the power of the PC to bring every corner of this massive, rich and detailed world to life including increased draw distances; higher quality global illumination and ambient occlusion for improved day and night lighting; improved reflections and deeper, higher resolution shadows at all distances; tessellated tree textures and improved grass and fur textures for added realism in every plant and animal.

Red Dead Redemption 2 for PC also offers HDR support, the ability to run high-end display setups with 4K resolution and beyond, multi-monitor configurations, widescreen configurations, faster frame rates and more.

[h1][b]Vengeance Is An Idiot’s Game.[/b][/h1]
[b]Red Dead Redemption 2 is a true work of art.[/b] [list]
[*]This game takes you on a journey that is unlike any other, filled with amazing characters, an immersive open world, and an engrossing story that will keep you hooked until the very end.
The storyline is emotionally gripping and skillfully crafted, the themes of redemption and loyalty are deeply moving, and the writing is some of the best in any video game.
[*]Many different activities, dialogues and a friendly atmosphere made me spend all my time in the camp. And I like it! Every member of the Van der Linde gang feels like a real person with their own distinct personality and backstory. You'll grow to love them, hate them, and feel for them as the story progresses.[/list] [quote=Arthur Morgan][b]Vengeance Is An Idiot’s Game[/b][/quote] [list] [*]and the game drives home this point in a powerful way. The consequences of revenge are explored through the characters' actions and the outcomes that follow. The game shows that revenge only leads to more pain and suffering, and the only way to break the cycle is through forgiveness and redemption.
[*][b][u]RDR 2 is a game that you don't just play, but you live.[/u][/b] This is the best game of this generation. If you're a fan of open-world games, westerns, or just great storytelling, you owe it to yourself to play this game. It's an unforgettable experience that will stick with you long after the credits roll.[/list][hr][/hr]

Having previously played RDR I had a strong feeling I would enjoy the prequel just as much. I originally played RDR2 on Xbox when it launched in 2018. I fell in love with this game and it's characters straight away and spent hundreds of hours exploring everything its open world had to offer. This game is an absolute masterpiece and one of the best games I have ever played. The attention to detail in this game is incredible. I could spend hours wandering around the wilderness admiring it's atmosphere. The campaign is one of the best adventures I have ever experienced. The only bad thing about the story is the emptiness you feel as soon as it ends.

[b] Introduction [/b]
This is one of the games where I would just turn cinematic camera on and enjoy the immersion. [b][i] Do note that I don't usually write a review or make an essay out of it but this game deserve one!. [/i][/b] The game itself is very immersive probably one of the best I've experienced. The landscapes are awe-inspiring, from the rugged mountains to the rolling plains, each with its own distinct atmosphere and beauty. The attention to detail is staggering, with dynamic weather and realistic animal behavior breathing life into the surroundings. It's a world that basically begs players to explore.

[b] Development [/b]
The greatest thing R2D2 have to offer is the deeply engrossing character development of Arthur Morgan. As a member of the Van der Linde gang, Arthur is a complex protagonist with a troubled past and a conflicted moral compass. Through the course of the game, players witness his transformation from a loyal outlaw blindly following his leader to a man questioning his actions and searching for redemption. The writing and voice acting are exceptional, capturing the nuances of Arthur's personality and emotional growth.

[b] World Immersion[/b]
The open world is filled with diverse missions, side quests, and activities that complement the overarching story. Whether engaging in intense shootouts (as always~), doing heists, or simply exploring the wilderness, the gameplay remains consistently captivating. I have over 70+ hours now and I haven't even complete my first playthrough (due to exploring the map, side-activities and irl education/work). With all that, there are still things which I have yet too discover! Like who is Gavin??!

[b] TRY IT! [/b]
Whether you're drawn to the allure of the Wild West or simply appreciate a masterfully story driven game, Red Dead Redemption 2 is an absolute must-play. While writing this down I should also note that Arthur Morgan is hands down the best protagonist out there!<3

[h3]Now THIS is how to tell a story.[/h3]
Red Dead Redemption 2 features the most gripping narrative I’ve ever seen in a video game. The epic journey of Dutch Van der Linde's gang of outlaws is full of so many jaw-dropping, cinematic, action-packed moments, but still stays believable as the protagonist Arthur Morgan slowly frees himself of his life-long gunslinger ideals. And every character in the Van der Linde gang’s saga feels remarkably human, thanks to fantastic writing and voice acting that perfectly complement this game’s stunning visuals, detailed animation and beautiful music.

All of these elements combine to make the world of Red Dead 2 come alive in a way that no other open world game does. The massive five-state map is incredibly dynamic, with missions, side quests and random events of equally high quality perfectly interwoven into an enchanting world that constantly changes with the flow of the main story. And there are so many little details throughout this game - from memorable NPCs to colorful customization options to fleshed-out minigames - that make the experience feel authentic.

Even though I absolutely loved the phenomenal story and atmospheric world of Red Dead 2, the gameplay mechanics can seem shallow when taken out of context. Granted, there’s nothing wrong with the core controls - the shootouts are fun even on controller thanks to the Deadeye time-slowdown ability, and riding around on a horse is simple but satisfying. However, responsive controls are sometimes de-emphasized in favor of handholding gameplay and "realism" in regard to difficulty and mission structure. Horses automatically steer themselves on rough terrain, animations make looting and crafting take longer, many missions include trailing sections so the player can get where they need to go… et cetera.

Usually, when a game prioritizes realism over immediate gameplay like this, there’s a weak link somewhere that breaks my immersion - such as bad voice acting, weak writing, faults in sound design or visuals, or spacing of content around the map. And this usually results in these “realistic” game mechanics becoming more tedious than they are immersive, distancing me from whatever atmosphere is trying to be established. But.. this isn’t the case with Red Dead Redemption 2.

[h3]Red Dead 2 might be the first game to [i]fully convince[/i] me of its own world's authenticity.[/h3]
The immaculately detailed world and unbelievably human characters of RDR2 breathe life into in-game tasks that I would normally consider boring, like trailing missions, herding animals and catching fish - making even these less inspired gameplay segments pretty damn fun. The gameplay mechanics aren’t untouchable on their own, but the sixty-hour-long story pretty much is, and it’s paired with an intricate portrayal of 1899 America that makes the narrative just as enthralling as some of the greatest movies and TV shows ever made. This commitment to realism and thorough storytelling makes even the slower paced segments of the game exciting, and the intense parts (like shootouts) more meaningful.

I’m already partway through my second playthrough now, and I’m having even more fun this time around trying to dissect the incredible character dynamics and details of the open world now that I’ve beaten the game already. The more I play Red Dead 2, the more fascinated I am with the spectacular story and cast of characters - and the few issues I originally had with the mechanics have become less and less noticeable in the grand scheme of RDR2’s monumental scope. Rockstar has created a true masterpiece here, and the gripping tale of outlaw Arthur Morgan is a story I’ll never forget. 10/10

RDR2 undoubtedly stands as a masterpiece in the realm of open-world games, solidifying its place as a true GOAT contender. With its vast and immersive world, the game offers an unparalleled level of freedom and a staggering number of quests that cater to a wide range of player preferences and interests.

One of the most remarkable aspects of RDR2 is its sheer scope. The game presents players with a sprawling open world, meticulously crafted and teeming with life. From the bustling cities to the untamed wilderness, every inch of the game is bursting with breathtaking detail and realism. As you traverse the landscape, you'll encounter dynamic weather patterns, diverse wildlife, and a rich ecosystem that reacts organically to your actions. This level of attention to detail creates an immersive experience that draws players into the vibrant and authentic Old West setting.

Questing in RDR2 is a true delight. The game offers an impressive variety of missions, ensuring that players can find their niche and embark on a personal journey within the game's narrative. Whether you're drawn to intense shootouts and thrilling heists or prefer more peaceful pursuits like hunting or fishing, RDR2 caters to every playstyle. The quests are expertly crafted, with engaging storylines, memorable characters, and unexpected twists that keep you hooked from beginning to end. Each quest feels purposeful and contributes to the overall narrative, making the game feel cohesive and rewarding.

Beyond the main story quests, RDR2 provides an abundance of side activities and optional objectives, guaranteeing that players will always have something to discover or pursue. From challenging bounty hunts to stumbling upon hidden treasures, the game is brimming with content that encourages exploration and rewards curiosity. Additionally, the game features a dynamic honor system that responds to your choices and actions, allowing for different gameplay experiences and multiple story outcomes.

Furthermore, the level of detail in RDR2 extends beyond the quests themselves. The world feels alive, populated by a diverse cast of characters, each with their own unique stories and motivations. Engaging in random encounters or interacting with the residents of the game world often leads to unexpected and memorable experiences. Whether it's engaging in a lively conversation in a saloon, stumbling upon a group of outlaws in the wilderness, or witnessing a dramatic event unfold before your eyes, RDR2 constantly surprises and immerses you in its living, breathing world.

In conclusion, Red Dead Redemption 2 is an unparalleled free-world game that deserves its status as a GOAT. With its vast and immersive world, diverse range of quests, and meticulous attention to detail, the game sets a new standard for open-world experiences. RDR2 invites players to embark on a personal journey within its captivating narrative, ensuring that every player can find their own niche and create their own unforgettable adventures in the Old West.

applist.name: Assassin's Creed® Odyssey
applist.detailed_description:
Ultimate Edition



Enhance your Assassin's Creed® Odyssey experience with the ULTIMATE EDITION, including the game, the DELUXE PACK and the SEASON PASS.

Continue your epic odyssey with two new, major story arcs in the SEASON PASS with three exciting episodes per story.
Season pass owners also receive the games Assassin's Creed III REMASTERED and Assassin's Creed Liberation REMASTERED.


Gold Edition



Enhance your Assassin's Creed® Odyssey experience with the GOLD EDITION including the game and the SEASON PASS.

Continue your epic odyssey with two new major story arcs in the SEASON PASS with three exciting episodes per story.
Season pass owners also receive the games Assassin's Creed III REMASTERED and Assassin's Creed Liberation REMASTERED.


Deluxe Edition



Upgrade your game experience with the DELUXE EDITION which includes the game and the Deluxe Pack.

The Deluxe Pack  includes:
- The Kronos Pack (Including 5 epic pieces of armour, 1 epic weapon, 1 epic mount)
- The Herald of Dusk Pack (Including 5 rare pieces of armour, 1 rare weapon)
- The Capricornus Naval Pack (Including 1 ship design, 1 crew theme)
- 1 Temporary XP Boost
- 1 Temporary Drachmas Boost


About the Game

Choose your fate in Assassin's Creed® Odyssey.
From outcast to living legend, embark on an odyssey to uncover the secrets of your past and change the fate of Ancient Greece.

TRAVEL TO ANCIENT GREECE
From lush vibrant forests to volcanic islands and bustling cities, start a journey of exploration and encounters in a war torn world shaped by gods and men.

FORGE YOUR LEGEND
Your decisions will impact how your odyssey unfolds. Play through multiple endings thanks to the new dialogue system and the choices you make. Customize your gear, ship, and special abilities to become a legend.

FIGHT ON A NEW SCALE
Demonstrate your warrior's abilities in large scale epic battles between Athens and Sparta featuring hundreds of soldiers, or ram and cleave your way through entire fleets in naval battles across the Aegean Sea.

GAZE IN WONDER
Experience the action in a whole new light with Tobii Eye Tracking. The Extended View feature gives you a broader perspective of the environment, and the Dynamic Light and Sun Effects immerse you in the sandy dunes according to where you set your sights. Tagging, aiming and locking on your targets becomes a lot more natural when you can do it by looking at them. Let your vision lead the way and enhance your gameplay.
Visit the Tobii website to check the list of compatible devices.
-----
Additional notes:
Eye tracking features available with Tobii Eye Tracking.

content_descriptors.notes: This is an action-adventure game in which players assume the role of Alexios or Kassandra, mercenaries on a quest for vengeance. As players explore an open-world environment in Ancient Greece, they interact with characters, infiltrate enemy bases and strongholds, and kill human enemies. Players use swords, spears, and bows to kill enemy soldiers and bandits in melee-style combat. Players also use stealth attacks (e.g., knife stabbing) to dispatch enemies discreetly. Large blood-splatter effects occur as enemies are killed. A handful of cutscenes depict more intense acts of violence and/or gore: characters stabbed through the head/neck with bladed weapons; young characters thrown off a cliff; a man mauled by a mob as his arm gets thrown into the air. Some environments depict severed limbs and dismembered corpses on the ground. The game contains instances of sexual material: characters kissing and caressing before the screen fades to black (sex is implied though never shown); dialogue referencing sex and prostitution (e.g., “Anything goes in this sex andron”; “That is love, this is commerce. What are you into?”); a character hearing sexual moaning sounds behind a door. The words “f**k” and “sh*t” are heard in the game.

[h1] You can bang almost everyone 10 outta 10 [/h1]
[hr][/hr]
[b] Spoiler free review [/b] 

nah but for real:
Really amazing how far graphics has come, and the scale of the maps. This game is definitely beautiful and large. 

The story is amazing, if you like the main thing in the lore of Assassins creed, this game definitely gives you a lot of info on it. And choices you make matter, i will definitely be playing it with new game+ and do things that i wish i had done differently. But i recommend you to play it not knowing what choices do what down the line, since you can play as the female [spoiler] Kassandra [/spoiler] , and or the male [spoiler] Alexios [/spoiler].

At the start of the game i felt a bit overwhelmed by everything, but after exploring a bit and doing some quests i got a hang of it. 
in comparison to Origins, its not as good, but its still a Master piece!

The main quests and side quests are great, but there are these quests all around that have a time glass on them, those quests feel poorly made. Most of the dialogue in those quests are interesting at the start, but then when it comes to what they want you to do, it defaults to the same ones over and over and over again. so i just skip the dialogue most of the time. Although very rarely they will say something new. Often you get a dialogue decision to ask them what they want from you, but its always just answer nr1, so it feels tedious, like they added it in to make you want to listen to the dialogue, which after 100 hours, I don't. These quests are also the main way (from what I've seen) to get XP and money, and they are usually very short and just boring.

For some reason they designed the horse to trot when you are 200 meters within a city, town, fort or whatever, and it doesn't matter if its way above you on a cliff, your horse will not gallop. Which is extremely annoying and i don't understand why they did this

They have a great system for your armor and weapons, where you can change the look of your armor to any you have received. although i don't understand why epic armor has 3 engravings enabling you to get 4, while the legendary armor only has 2 unless you have the complete set which then you get 3, plus you could add the 4th. but this makes the epic armor way better in most cases, as you can get much better engravings on them than the legendary. 

The combat is alright, similar to Origins except you don't have a shield.

The game doesn't really tell you how to change arrows except in the loading screens where it occasionally pops up telling you to press g to switch arrows, didn't see that hint until like 40 hours in, and at that point i just googled it.

The boat battles are cool, and different from the old games, in a good way. the upgrades get ridiculously expensive, but you make the money back fast, but the resources can be a hassle.

I have a lot more I could say about this game, but I think I've covered what stood out the most for me

I Recommend this game, you get a long playtime and it has good replay value.

Assassin's Creed Odyssey is a highly immersive and detailed action-adventure game from Ubisoft. From the stunning Ancient Greek landscapes and cities, to the engaging storyline and engaging combat and stealth mechanics, this game has a lot of exciting content and provides hours of quality entertainment. With its big open world packed with side-quests, bounties and mysterious artifacts to uncover, this game will keep you hooked for weeks. One of the most standout aspects of the game is its incredible attention to detail, with period-accurate buildings, characters, and artwork. The game also features an engaging narrative that takes its time to tell, allowing for some truly fascinating moments that will leave a lasting impression. With its deep character customization and upgrade systems, Odyssey also provides a unique and varied experience that can be tailored to the player’s preference. While some aspects of the game can be tedious, it never detracts from the overall experience, and the engaging gameplay kept me coming back for more. Assassin’s Creed Odyssey is an enjoyable action-adventure game with an enormous amount of content, engaging combat, and an interesting storyline. Its immersive world and varied mechanics provide an enjoyable, memorable experience and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and engaging game.
assasin game about assasins where you assassin against other assasin or not assassissin you are the best assassin in all assassin assasin so assassin

First of all, as preface, I have achieved basically 100% in this game including the two DLCs so one could I say I really love and adore this game. 

Having said that, this game is definitely not a perfect game for everyone. The story is a tad bit bland overall and isn't what hooked me in this game. I mostly ignored the main quest really until I powered through it in one or two sittings. Adding to that, this game didn't feel as much as a typical game in the Assassins Creed series but more as a RPG in the world of Assassins Creed, which is totally fine for me because it's still a great game, but I understand everyone who was a little disappointed.
What really chained to this game though, is the world building and the main character (DISCLAIMER: I played as Kassandra). 
Kassandra to me, was one of the most loveable (and hot; I admit it :) ) protagonists I've ever played with. I love her personality and attitude but also the genuine sorrow and grief they were able to make her show. On top of that, her voice actress/also her motion double did such an outstanding job.
Now to the world the developing team put out: I'm not from Greece and hvae only been there a few times, but I absolutely loved every second of exploring the ancient version. They really made the world feel alive and inhabitated and while fulfilling objectives on the map was, due to it being mostly Copy and Paste as Ubisoft typically does, pretty boring most of the times, I still had the motivation to keep going the whole distance. And let me tell you: The world is actually enormous. Part of the reason I kept going definitely were the mechanics overall and especially during fighting. The ability tree is really well made and almost all abilities feel useful at some point and in some build. Naturally some abilities are generally more useful than other but the overall balance is very good.

In short: I really enjoyed the game and it is a really good RPG, probably one of the best I have ever played and I enjoyed every second I played.

A Dazzling Journey through History: Assassin's Creed

Rating: ★★★★★

Assassin's Creed, the long-standing franchise known for its captivating blend of historical settings and thrilling stealth gameplay, once again delivers an exceptional experience with its latest installment. This time, players are transported to a meticulously crafted world where they can dive into the rich tapestry of history and embark on an unforgettable adventure.

The attention to detail in Assassin's Creed is nothing short of remarkable. From the bustling streets of ancient Rome to the vibrant markets of Renaissance Florence, every historical period is beautifully recreated, immersing players in a captivating and authentic atmosphere. The level of historical accuracy is commendable, and it's evident that the developers have poured their hearts into recreating these iconic time periods.

It's not the best AC game but it's definitely fun to play. I love being immersed in the world at the time, this game seems to do it well. Not quite as good as Origins but definitely up there.

applist.name: NBA 2K23
applist.detailed_description:
NBA 2K23 Michael Jordan Edition


The NBA 2K23 Michael Jordan Edition includes:
• 100,000 Virtual Currency
• 10,000 MyTEAM Points
• 10 MyTEAM Tokens
• Sapphire Devin Booker and Ruby Michael Jordan MyTEAM Cards
• 23 MyTEAM Promo Packs (Receive 10 at launch plus an Amethyst topper pack, then 2 per week for 6 weeks)
• Free Agent Option MyTEAM Pack
• Diamond Jordan Shoe MyTEAM card
• Ruby Coach Card MyTEAM Pack
• 10 Boosts for each MyCAREER Skill Boost type
• 10 Boosts for each Gatorade Boost type
• 4 Cover Athlete T-Shirts for your MyPLAYER
• MyPLAYER backpack and arm sleeve
• Custom-design skateboard for MyPLAYER
• One 2-Hr Double XP Coin


About the Game

Rise to the occasion and realize your full potential in NBA 2K23. Prove yourself against the best players in the world and showcase your talent in MyCAREER. Pair today’s All-Stars with timeless legends in MyTEAM. Build a dynasty of your own in MyGM or take the NBA in a new direction with MyLEAGUE. Take on NBA or WNBA teams in PLAY NOW and experience true-to-life gameplay. How will you Answer the Call?

TAKE MORE CONTROL
Feel refined gameplay in the palm of your hands on both sides of the ball in NBA 2K23. Attack the basket with a new arsenal of offensive skill-based moves, while you unleash your potential as a lockdown defender with new 1-on-1 mechanics to stifle opposing players at every turn.

AN EPIC VOYAGE AWAITS
Embark on a swashbuckling basketball journey aboard a spacious cruiseliner equipped with pristine courts, scenic views, and a boatload of rewards for you and your MyPLAYER to enjoy. Plus, there’s even more to explore during shore excursions.

JORDAN CHALLENGE RETURNS
Step back in time with era-specific visuals that captured Michael Jordan’s ascent from collegiate sensation to global icon with immersive Jordan Challenges chronicling his career-defining dominance. Lace up his shoes to recreate his otherworldly stat lines and iconic last shots, while listening to first-hand accounts from those who witnessed his maturation from budding star to basketball legend.

BUILD YOUR SQUAD
Ball without limits as you collect and assemble a bevy of legendary talent from any era in MyTEAM. Dominate the hardwood each Season, and bring your vision to life with a broad set of customization tools to create the perfect look for your perfect starting five.
applist.about_the_game:
Rise to the occasion and realize your full potential in NBA 2K23. Prove yourself against the best players in the world and showcase your talent in MyCAREER. Pair today’s All-Stars with timeless legends in MyTEAM. Build a dynasty of your own in MyGM or take the NBA in a new direction with MyLEAGUE. Take on NBA or WNBA teams in PLAY NOW and experience true-to-life gameplay. How will you Answer the Call?

TAKE MORE CONTROL
Feel refined gameplay in the palm of your hands on both sides of the ball in NBA 2K23. Attack the basket with a new arsenal of offensive skill-based moves, while you unleash your potential as a lockdown defender with new 1-on-1 mechanics to stifle opposing players at every turn.

AN EPIC VOYAGE AWAITS
Embark on a swashbuckling basketball journey aboard a spacious cruiseliner equipped with pristine courts, scenic views, and a boatload of rewards for you and your MyPLAYER to enjoy. Plus, there’s even more to explore during shore excursions.

JORDAN CHALLENGE RETURNS
Step back in time with era-specific visuals that captured Michael Jordan’s ascent from collegiate sensation to global icon with immersive Jordan Challenges chronicling his career-defining dominance. Lace up his shoes to recreate his otherworldly stat lines and iconic last shots, while listening to first-hand accounts from those who witnessed his maturation from budding star to basketball legend.

BUILD YOUR SQUAD
Ball without limits as you collect and assemble a bevy of legendary talent from any era in MyTEAM. Dominate the hardwood each Season, and bring your vision to life with a broad set of customization tools to create the perfect look for your perfect starting five.
applist.short_description: Rise to the occasion in NBA 2K23. Showcase your talent in MyCAREER. Pair All-Stars with timeless legends in MyTEAM. Build your own dynasty in MyGM, or guide the NBA in a new direction with MyLEAGUE. Take on NBA or WNBA teams in PLAY NOW and feel true-to-life gameplay.

NBA 2K23

NBA 2K23 is a yet another follow-up in the long-standing 2K basketball franchise that continues to release repeated versions of the same game, re-skinned and re-titled to fit the year, and the real-life players drafted that year, it represents. As expected the core gameplay has been worked on to perfection for years now so players know what will be brought to the table - just an overall smooth and crushingly-detailed basketball simulator. This isn't the first time Micheal Jordan has graced the cover of a 2K sports game, but a lot of time has passed since then and things have changed for the good and for the bad.

If you look to play this, you have to consider many things: do you care about the you-against-the-AI aspect of it all or do you really crave that online player-vs-player feel. If your heart lies somewhere in the middle, you have to choose a side here because there's no in-between. Playing online-only means that you will have two years at max before the servers are shut down intentionally, forcing you to pay top dollar for the inevitable next installment. Playing against the AI means 2K can't do s**t to you if you want to stay in 2K23, having fun at the various modes it has to offer - NBA 2K23 will be playable even after the specific game has been deleted from the store. So choose carefully... when it's on sale (don't feed the pigs even more).

On PC, this game is fun to play against the AI - no bugs, no glitches and an overall satisfied experience playing completely alone. Do I recommend NBA 2K23? Yes, if you play against the AI, If you aim to play online - please read the other reviews of players who've had an even greater experience than me there. It's a lot to unpack there, for sure.

applist.name: Assassin's Creed® III Remastered
applist.detailed_description:
Relive the American Revolution or experience it for the first time in Assassin's Creed® III Remastered, with enhanced graphics and improved gameplay mechanics. Also includes Assassin's Creed Liberation remastered and all solo DLC content.

FIGHT FOR FREEDOM
1775. The American Colonies are about to revolt. As Connor, a Native American Assassin, secure liberty for your people and your nation. From bustling city streets to the chaotic battlefields, assassinate your foes in a variety of deadly ways with a vast array of weaponry.

A NEW VISUAL AND GAMEPLAY EXPERIENCE
Play the iconic Assassin's Creed III, with enhanced graphics, now featuring: 4K resolution, new character models, polished environment rendering and more. The gameplay mechanics have been revamped as well, improving your experience and your immersion.

ADDITIONAL CONTENT
Also includes all the original solo DLC, including The Tyranny of King Washington, and the full game: Assassin's Creed Liberation Remastered.

applist.name: Forza Horizon 4
applist.detailed_description:
Forza Horizon 4 Ultimate Edition


The Forza Horizon 4 Ultimate Edition digital bundle includes the full game and Car Pass, VIP Membership, Formula Drift Car Pack, Best of Bond Car Pack, and the Fortune Island and LEGO® Speed Champions game expansions.


Forza Horizon 4 Deluxe Edition


The Forza Horizon 4 Deluxe Edition digital bundle includes the Car Pass and the Formula Drift Car Pack.


About the Game

Dynamic seasons change everything at the world’s greatest automotive festival. Go it alone or team up with others to explore beautiful and historic Britain in a shared open world. Collect, modify and drive over 450 cars. Race, stunt, create and explore – choose your own path to become a Horizon Superstar.


Collect Over 450 Cars
Enjoy the largest and most diverse Horizon car roster yet, including over 100 licensed manufacturers.


Race. Stunt. Create. Explore.
In the new open-ended campaign, everything you do progresses your game.


Explore a Shared World
Real players populate your world. When time of day, weather and seasons change, everyone playing the game experiences it at the same time.


Explore Beautiful, Historic Britain
This is Britain Like You’ve Never Seen it. Discover lakes, valleys, castles, and breathtaking scenery all in spectacular native 4K and HDR.

[h1]Forza Horizon 4: Unleashing the Racing Beast[/h1]

Overall Rating: ★★★★★

Forza Horizon 4, developed by Playground Games and published by Microsoft Studios, delivers an exhilarating open-world racing experience that is sure to captivate racing enthusiasts and casual gamers alike. Set in the picturesque landscapes of Great Britain, the game offers a vast and dynamic world filled with thrilling races, stunning visuals, and a wide variety of cars to collect and customize.

Graphics: ★★★★★
Forza Horizon 4 boasts stunning graphics that showcase the beauty of the British countryside in great detail. The changing seasons add a dynamic element to the visuals, with each season offering a unique and visually striking environment. From lush forests to picturesque lakes and charming villages, the game's graphics are truly impressive.

Gameplay: ★★★★★
The gameplay of Forza Horizon 4 is where it truly shines. The controls are responsive and intuitive, allowing players to navigate through the open-world seamlessly. The variety of race events, including street races, off-road challenges, and stunt jumps, keep the gameplay exciting and diverse. The inclusion of a dynamic weather system and the ability to drive in different seasons further enhances the gameplay experience.

Car Selection and Customization: ★★★★☆
Forza Horizon 4 offers a vast selection of over 450 cars from various manufacturers, ranging from classic models to modern supercars. The game allows players to customize their cars with different paint jobs, upgrades, and tuning options, providing a satisfying level of personalization and allowing players to create their dream racing machines.

Multiplayer: ★★★★☆
The multiplayer aspect of Forza Horizon 4 adds another layer of excitement to the game. Players can join online races and compete against others in a variety of events and challenges. The seamless integration of multiplayer features and the ability to interact with other players in the shared world enhances the social aspect of the game.

Content and Replayability: ★★★★★
Forza Horizon 4 offers a vast amount of content to explore and enjoy. The game features a wide range of races, challenges, and activities scattered throughout the open world. Additionally, the inclusion of seasonal events and regular updates keep the game fresh and provide ample opportunities for replayability.

Conclusion:
Forza Horizon 4 is a standout racing game that offers an immersive and thrilling open-world experience. With its stunning graphics, diverse gameplay, extensive car selection, and a wealth of content to explore, the game provides endless hours of enjoyment for racing enthusiasts. Whether you're a casual player or a hardcore racing fan, Forza Horizon 4 is a must-play title that showcases the best of the racing genre.

applist.name: Orcs Must Die! 3
applist.detailed_description:
Orcs Must Die! 3 ushers orc-slaying mayhem to a previously unimaginable scale. Solo, or 2 player co-op, arm yourself with a massive arsenal of traps and weapons. Slice, burn, toss and zap hordes of repugnant orcs in this long-awaited successor to the award-winning series.

New to the series, War Scenarios pit players against the largest orc armies ever assembled. Mountable War Machines give players the essential firepower to heave, stab, carbonize, and disarticulate the abominable intruders.

More of Everything - Orcs Must Die! 3 is everything fans loved about the first two games and more. More orcs, more traps, more weapons, more upgrades and even better looking. It’s cranked up to at least eleven.

New Story - Play through a brand new story set more than 20 years after Orcs Must Die! 2, where the War Mage and Sorceress have rebuilt the order and trained new young apprentices.

War Scenarios - All new War Scenarios deliver on the promise of massive scale first set out in Orcs Must Die! Confront overwhelming armies of orcs outside on the battlefields surrounding the castles. Thin out waves of orcs hundreds strong before they breach the walls and crash your rift.

War Machines - You’re going to need new weapons of death and destruction to handle these hordes. War Machines are traps on an oversized scale. Lay down your mega flip trap and launch dozens of ragdolling orcs. Mount your mega boom barrel launcher and unleash pyrotechnic glory.

It Never Stops - The legions of orcs keep coming long after the story is completed. Etch your name into the orc-slaying hall of fame through Weekly Challenges or see how long you can survive in Endless Mode.

Take Drastic Steps - Orcs Must Die! 3 comes with the Drastic Steps campaign and content for free, including terrifying flying enemies, heroic war guardians and of course more tools for orc destruction!

Scramble to Survive - The new Scramble Mode pits you against vile orcs who evolve with increasingly difficult and sinister tricks up their chunky sleeves. But each level you survive, you collect your own modifiers to fight back with!
applist.about_the_game:
Orcs Must Die! 3 ushers orc-slaying mayhem to a previously unimaginable scale. Solo, or 2 player co-op, arm yourself with a massive arsenal of traps and weapons. Slice, burn, toss and zap hordes of repugnant orcs in this long-awaited successor to the award-winning series.

New to the series, War Scenarios pit players against the largest orc armies ever assembled. Mountable War Machines give players the essential firepower to heave, stab, carbonize, and disarticulate the abominable intruders.

More of Everything - Orcs Must Die! 3 is everything fans loved about the first two games and more. More orcs, more traps, more weapons, more upgrades and even better looking. It’s cranked up to at least eleven.

New Story - Play through a brand new story set more than 20 years after Orcs Must Die! 2, where the War Mage and Sorceress have rebuilt the order and trained new young apprentices.

War Scenarios - All new War Scenarios deliver on the promise of massive scale first set out in Orcs Must Die! Confront overwhelming armies of orcs outside on the battlefields surrounding the castles. Thin out waves of orcs hundreds strong before they breach the walls and crash your rift.

War Machines - You’re going to need new weapons of death and destruction to handle these hordes. War Machines are traps on an oversized scale. Lay down your mega flip trap and launch dozens of ragdolling orcs. Mount your mega boom barrel launcher and unleash pyrotechnic glory.

It Never Stops - The legions of orcs keep coming long after the story is completed. Etch your name into the orc-slaying hall of fame through Weekly Challenges or see how long you can survive in Endless Mode.

Take Drastic Steps - Orcs Must Die! 3 comes with the Drastic Steps campaign and content for free, including terrifying flying enemies, heroic war guardians and of course more tools for orc destruction!

Scramble to Survive - The new Scramble Mode pits you against vile orcs who evolve with increasingly difficult and sinister tricks up their chunky sleeves. But each level you survive, you collect your own modifiers to fight back with!

reviews.review:
All Orcs Must Die games have been one of the best Tower Defense games made. Didn't seem like their heart was in OMD3 and seemed to be a fast cash game (maybe to support another game) that hasn't changed much since OMD2. It's a fun game for a few months at most, but the additional subject matter that was added to this game is lacking. I think most players noticed this after posting a good review, but didn't take the time to revise their review, because of the state of games today. If we had any other similar game options to compare, we would have noticed how little OMD3 has improved. 

Unchained had many issues, but this game seems to have a lot of the same and a few new issues. Adding more orcs on the screen at one time was nice (for a few maps) but most of the maps are small without much strategy or manipulating needed at all. Teamwork was much better in Unchained and I didn't feel like another game publisher was out to get more money than the game was worth. Seems the only thing this game did to make the maps "hard" was add more life and greatly increase the speed of the orcs. This made some of the smaller maps seem like the orcs were running faster than the heroes. Don't get me started on the lack of money we started with. Can't give us much money to buy traps when the maps are so small and boring. The 'good o' days' of gaming is lost with the must pay more for DLC (just to be a full game) or pay-to-win styles that have taken over.
Even while the game is 2 years old and on sale, they release a patch that rebalances the game to be more enjoyable.
Played lots of OMD1 and 2. 3 is a great successor and would def recommend as a great co op title.

Just as good as 1 and 2, and co-op is nice as always. Still hoping for a multiplayer that allows for more than 2 players. Feel like not a ton of new innovation among traps but no need to fix what aint broke I guess. Decent split between the trapping and over shoulder action play.

Very fun game to play casually and satisfying difficulty settings for harder levels.
Wouldn't recommend if you are looking to go for high scores in endless, still has random crashes even after the new patch.

لعبه ممتعه في طور تعاوني مع خويك حمااااااااااس

Very fun game

I'd recommend this game - if a crash hadn't corrupted my save. It's got a lot of fun traps in it, and the tower defense / dungeonkeeper  element of it had a good mouthfeel. Just don't understand how a crash, instead of simply not saving the changes of that (incredibly short) session, makes like a 20 hour save completely unusable.

I had this game along with the first (Orcs Must Die!) and second (Orcs Must Die! 2) one in my library for some time but did not think to play it.

Somehow, I recently decided to try this one (Orcs Must Die! 3) out first and I gotta say, it's really fun! It's also challenging, again in a fun way, if you decide to go for perfect scores beating the level within the par time. Plus there are several other challenges which I have not tried yet!

At the time of this review, I'm still only on the main campaign Level 11, so it is quite a long way to the end but this game gets my thumbs up! Highly recommended!
These orcs gotta die because it's funny

I enjoyed the first 2 OMDs, but didn't play the online one so its been awhile. I enjoyed this though can't see myself playing it as much as the first. Gameplay was fine and didn't experience any real bugs, so hey I enjoyed it for a bit. I did enjoy the big sieges as a change of pace too. I wish there were more maps however.

applist.name: Borderlands 3
applist.detailed_description:
Borderlands 3 Ultimate Edition

Borderlands 3 Ultimate Edition is the quintessential Borderlands 3 experience, featuring the base game plus all 6 content add-ons and the full collection of bonus cosmetic packs!


Borderlands 3 Super Deluxe Edition

Continue your Borderlands 3 adventure with the Season Pass!

This content is included with purchase of the Borderlands 3 Super Deluxe Edition, Borderlands 3 Ultimate Edition, and Borderlands 3 Collector's Edition.

The Season Pass includes:

  • Moxxi’s Heist of the Handsome Jackpot campaign add-on.
  • Guns, Love, and Tentacles campaign add-on.
  • Bounty of Blood campaign add-on.
  • Psycho Krieg and the Fantastic Fustercluck campaign add-on.
  • All 4 Multiverse Final Form Cosmetic Packs.
  • A Butt Stallion weapon skin, weapon trinket and grenade mod.


About the Game


The original shooter-looter returns, packing bazillions of guns and an all-new mayhem-fueled adventure! Blast through new worlds and enemies as one of four brand new Vault Hunters – the ultimate treasure-seeking badasses of the Borderlands, each with deep skill trees, abilities, and customization. Play solo or join with friends to take on insane enemies, score loads of loot and save your home from the most ruthless cult leaders in the galaxy.

A MAYHEM-FUELED THRILL RIDE

Stop the fanatical Calypso Twins from uniting the bandit clans and claiming the galaxy’s ultimate power. Only you, a thrill-seeking Vault Hunter, have the arsenal and allies to take them down.

YOUR VAULT HUNTER, YOUR PLAYSTYLE

Become one of four extraordinary Vault Hunters, each with unique abilities, playstyles, deep skill trees, and tons of personalization options. All Vault Hunters are capable of awesome mayhem alone, but together they are unstoppable.

LOCK, LOAD, AND LOOT

With bazillions of guns and gadgets, every fight is an opportunity to score new gear. Firearms with self-propelling bullet shields? Check. Rifles that spawn fire-spewing volcanoes? Obviously. Guns that grow legs and chase down enemies while hurling verbal insults? Yeah, got that too.

NEW BORDERLANDS

Discover new worlds beyond Pandora, each featuring unique environments to explore and enemies to destroy. Tear through hostile deserts, battle your way across war-torn cityscapes, navigate deadly bayous, and more!

QUICK & SEAMLESS CO-OP ACTION

Play with anyone at any time with online co-op, regardless of your level or mission progress.
