reviews.review:
Here's how to maximise your Borderlands 3 experience:

- Go into the settings and mute all dialogue
- Skip all cutscenes
- Make sure your subtitles are turned off
- Tab out to Spotify and start your favourite podcast
- Tab back into the game and enjoy!

This is the only way to truly experience all that this game has to offer!

Best Borderlands in terms of Gameplay, Gunplay, Vault Hunters, and Loot

Worst Borderlands in terms of Story and some of the DLC

The writing in this game is atrocious! All dialogues, story, and random interactions are just dumb and annoying. Borderlands used to be funny - this ain't it. 
A good thing about this game is that you can still run around and mindlessly shoot everything. 
Bottom line - it's an OK game to kill some time.
no one reads these anyway so il just say im gay
All you need to know is Good Gameplay, and Gunplay, with Bad story-telling and writing. Just keep in mind the shooting looting aspect of this game, and [b]DON'T TAKE THIS GAME TOO SERIOUSLY!!![/b}

Gameplay - 9/10
Story - that’s some cringe ass writing
Just watch K6 or Joltzdude on yt. You'll see.
Its kind of cringy, bl2 was better.

The game gone too far from its roots , theres much less dark humour  and the game lost its charm because of it. My opinion game  has too much  shiny shooting ammo everythings too bright and  you barely can see what your doing.  But the worst part is  when you buy  a full  ULTRA EXTREME DELUXE VERSION FOR FULL PRICE and after  a year  SEASON PASS 2 - a total cash grab  DLC  which  is  wery wery shity  and totaly not worth your money ,since iam an achievement hunter i was forced to buy this crap like allot of ppl did i guess. Thats why i give a big negative review.
Story is complete raging garbage. Real dumpster fire. Game play is pretty good though.

It's hard to understand what these developers were thinking, or what kind of strange pressure they were under. The core mechanics and gameplay found here are solid and entertaining, and that is usually the hardest part to nail in a game. However, everything around that core is a chore.

I am playing Borderlands 3 with multiple mods that remove dialogue and speed up animations, and the game still plays out incredibly slowly. There is a lot of starting and stopping, all the time, and then you have to sit through a lot of exposition from some uninportant side character, with nothing much to do because progression is tied to these monologues. Story in a game that is basically about upgrading loot should be skippable, but no... even with mods you still need to sit through the animations and so on.

If you add that to the fact that the difficulty is quite low overall, certainly lower than the two games before it, you end up with a great game being held back by the developers' obsession with the idea that they are great storytellers and that somehow this is the main point of the game. All the praise heaped upon Borderlands 2's story must be at fault here, but that was a juvenile story to begin with, propped up by interesting characters.

I can't say I recommend it, even though that parts that you are actually allowed to play are very fun. It often just feels like the game is wasting your time.
It's fun :D
Poor optimization
dont get a game u will enjoy suffer with boredom
it's certainly a game of all time

Possibly the most annoying cast (with very few exceptions) and least-interesting Vault Dwellers to play I have ever experienced in a Borderlands game so far. But hey, that's just Borderlands being Borderlands. This has nothing to do with my not recommending the game to others!

I do not recommend this game because of the CONSTANT AND RELENTLESS reminders and offers to buy the DLC you are stricken with as the game goes on. All throughout the hub ship and sometimes other places as well you'll see quest markers letting you know you have a new quest available - except you can only accept the quest(s) if you own the DLC. Well, this means the quest markers never go away!

Okay, so you try to remember the markers are part of a DLC and won't ever go away and just do your best to ignore them, right? Wrong. Passing by some of these DLC quest markers makes you receive an immediate radio message from the "main story protagonist" of said DLC letting you know they want to talk to you. This happens every time you return to the main hub and pass by it again. Some of them are placed near often-revisited NPCs and resources like the item vault so you can't avoid hearing them.

The whole thing just feels super scummy and predatory and I don't feel right supporting such practices.

Borderlands 3 has many facets that are great, and clear upgrades to its predecessors, such as the satisfying gunplay and the improved visuals. The game can be incredibly fun when you just get to zoom around the gameworld, shooting and killing everything that has a healthbar. The new vault hunters - Fl4k, Moze, Amara and Zane - have much more intricate and varied skill trees, and the introduction of Mayhem Mode should - in theory - add some much needed endgame. Ultimate Vault Hunter Mode (UVHM) was thankfully removed, and we don't have to deal with slag as a necessary evil anymore, either.
Bossfights are generally decent. They aren't particularly mechanical or demanding, but get the job done.
Co-op is (as always) the best aspect of the game, it can truly be a blast.

However, moments when the game is purely enjoyable are rare.
The first and most obvious weakness is the writing of the game. Characters are tropey, to the point that they feel like their dialogue was generated by a GenZ intern using ChatGPT. While the terrible dialogue adequately lends itself to the very one-dimensional villains, which are essentially just evil for evils sake and lack the same depth that Handsome Jack had in BL2, it becomes increasingly unbearable as the game goes on.
Don't even get me started on Ava, who might just be the worst character in any video game series so far.
There seems to be one repeating plot device: You defeat some kind of minor villain, you enter a fairly uninteresting, small vault for a minute, shit happens once you come out (someone gets killed or kidnapped, generally) and then you have to resolve the occurred shit before you can enter the next vault.

The pacing is pretty awful, as well. During the story (or any sidequest for that matter) you will also have to just sit around, waiting for dialogue to end, -constantly-. Buttons will be locked before a character has finished their speech, and the same holds true for objects that can only be destroyed once you have sat around long enough. This is fine on the first playthrough, but takes away massively from the replayability of the game. Many jokes have been made about BL3 being a "Talk to Lilith" simulator, and they are entirely accurate.

You will find a ton of bugs in this game, and I'm not just talking about the alien enemies. The game is littered with minor annoyances, such as incorrectly appearing subtitles, quests that don't correctly progress, NPCs (and your own vault hunter) getting stuck.. Most of them can be fixed by fast travelling or reloading the game, but there is one sidequest that can genuinely just break with no fix in sight (and this has been known since the game's release on Epic).
As a last point, the DLCs are overall pretty interesting (I particularly like the Gehenna and Xylurgous DLCs) and do a much better job than the basegame, even though they are plagued by a lot of the same problems. However, I find it hard to feel good about it as you would have to pay over 100€ to get all of the content unless you buy the game on sale.

Overall, BL3 falls flat in many regards. I would not recommend this game for its full price, though it is certainly worth it for 1-2 playthroughs if you buy it on sale.

The Story is pretty bad if you compared it with BL2, but without that comparison i think it's still fairly good.

The game-play tho is in my opinion this games biggest strength. 
The guns feel amazing and the skills are satisfying and fun to use.
Combat in general is extremely fun.

My only complaints are currently the distribution of loot and the difficulty.
I feel like you get way too much legendary gear, to the point where all other tiers of loot just kinda obsolete.
Don't get me wrong, I love all the cool unique yellow shiny stuff but it also makes it a lot less special to get what is supposed to be rare gear. So tuning it down a little bit would be good i think.

My second point is the difficulty, the game is really easy if you do just about any of the side quests.
Having an inventory full of powerful legendary guns doesn't help this.
If you are like me and do all side missions before continuing the story, you will likely melt bosses in seconds with the only thing stopping you being their (very annoying) invincibility phases
fun game great characters and loot loot loot

Borderlands 3 exceeds all the other previous games in terms of gameplay like a vast range of cool weapons that all do different things while also giving some Quality of life changes like being able to grapple onto ledges, slide etc. However, the story was absolutely terrible. Overall, I say pick this one up when it's on sale.

applist.name: In Sound Mind
applist.detailed_description:
As you awake in the corridors of an inexplicable building, you find the environment takes on a life of its own and leads you to discover a series of victims, all exposed to the same experimental chemical. In your search for answers, bizarre visions emerge and introduce a host of imposing horrors…and a cat named Tonia.

From the creators of the cult classic Nightmare House 2 comes In Sound Mind, a witty first-person psychological horror with frenetic puzzles and unique boss fights. Traverse a series of unsettling memories as you journey within the inner workings of the one place you can’t seem to escape—your own mind.


  • A new survival horror experience from the creators of the legendary Nightmare House 2. We Create Stuff, the team behind one of highest-rated mods of all time returns with an unexpected spin on the horror genre.
  • Experience a series of haunting memories. Journey through a progression of unsettling stories, each with unique puzzles, mechanics, weapons, and boss fights.
  • Overcome a cast of terrors. Confront those who stalk you in a series of daunting boss fights and learn how to defeat them by solving mind-bending puzzles.
  • An eerie soundtrack by The Living Tombstone. The internet icon lends his distinct sound to this next generation psychological thriller, with a distinctive song for each story.
  • Unexpect the expected. Explore an imaginative and disorienting narrative, featuring sentient mannequins, a feline companion, and much more. And yes, you can pet the cat.

reviews.review:
This game is such a gem and full of creative ideas executed perfectly.
If you like psychological horror movies, you will fall in love with this game.
Pretty fun. The game has similar vibes to Alan wake and isn't too scary.

This is shockingly well made, it has a very good story and some great enemy design. The audio is, in my opinion, the best part. The music is so good, and the enemies have a radius, like Dead by Daylight, where the music comes in from afar and gets louder and better the closer you get. I highly recommend this game.

This is a rare exception purchase for me since I mostly get games for their gameplay and not their story, but Im glad I made an exception with this one, especially since I got it on sale.
The best way I'd describe this game is that its like amnesia mixed with silent hill; it has silent hill's psychological driven horror narrative and amnesia's semi linear map exploration, with multiple maps that each have a unique monster and set  of different puzzles.

The absolute passion and soul poured into this game is unmatched and it's criminal that this didn't release to bigger success. The best way I can possibly describe it is like a sourcemod from an alternate universe where the developers had budgets, which should be no surprise considering who made it. If you've played nightmare house 2 or underhell you'll immediately understand, the game contains some tricky hl2 style platforming and the character controls extremely similar to Gordon, the only thing missing is the crouch jump. 
Otherwise I mean, it's a fantastic game. Story has a very interesting concept and the voice acting is really good, puzzles are decent and the setpieces are truly phenomenal- like the spooky mannequins that move when you're not looking but they actually help you this time. General combat is fairly mediocre with only a few enemy types, but it doesn't detract much. I also like how the big bad in each level, you know, the enemy you can't kill always has some weakness you can use to temporarily disable them so they get in your way less.
The weakest part would have to be the old factory, which contains an annoying building crawl searching for keys and an ABOMINABLE conveyor belt puzzle you have to solve while the big bad chases you around in a confined space. Generally, if you're expecting something really hardcore scary like Amnesia you might be disappointed, it's more of an adventure game with horror aesthetics sort of like Alan Wake. Honestly I prefer these, the gameplay has a lot more room to breathe when the developer isn't constantly trying to freak you out with unkillable stalkers and sanity management systems.
The best part by far in my opinion is something small, it's how every note you pick up is unique. It's not just a text popup like most games. Every character has different handwriting just like real life. Agent Rainbow, the main villain, writes in big scratchy oil slick text which gives him even more personality. It really is minor, but it shows a level of care you don't see too often.
This game is amazing, it shed a new light on me about how people struggle and it had an effect on me. 10/10 game.
One of the most unique "horror" experiences I've ever played, though I personally find that this would be even better in VR.

applist.name: Halo: The Master Chief Collection
applist.detailed_description:
The series that changed console gaming forever is on PC with six blockbuster games in one epic experience.

PC Settings/Optimizations

Halo: The Master Chief Collection is now optimized for PC and looking better than ever at up to 4k UHD and at 60+ FPS.* Other setting options include customizable mouse and keyboard support, ultrawide support, FOV customization, and more.


Campaign

Featuring Halo: Reach, Halo: Combat Evolved Anniversary, Halo 2: Anniversary, Halo 3, Halo 3: ODST Campaign, and Halo 4, The Master Chief Collection offers players their own exciting journey through the epic saga. Starting with the incredible bravery of Noble Six in Halo: Reach and ending with the rise of a new enemy in Halo 4, the Master Chief’s saga totals 67 campaign missions over six critically-acclaimed titles.


Multiplayer

Each of the six games in The Master Chief Collection brings its own multiplayer maps, modes and game types. With more than 120 multiplayer maps and countless ways to play with community-created Forge content the Collection has the most diverse and expansive Halo multiplayer experience to date.


Forge

Halo’s iconic map editor is improved, refreshed and better than ever. Build new maps with expanded functionality, increased budget, new objects and create new ways to play with custom game modes.**


*Look to system requirements for guidance on hardware minimum specs to achieve performance metrics.

**Forge mode not available in Halo: Combat Evolved Anniversary or Halo 3: ODST.

reviews.review: It's Halo

Overzealous and extremely self-righteous unimpartial moderators banning people for innocuous comments aside. 

I'd have to recommend against buying this until they fix major problems which are still unfixed even after half a year. Two of the more standout issues are the memory leak in Halo CE, a major problem where it starts eating your ram like a pig at a candy trough and Halo Reach missing most of its ambiance on certain levels, notably Sword Base. Other issues include terrible netcode in campaign mode, good luck if you try to play anything other than 3 with a friend, lack of split screen, and lack of a dedicated Custom Games Browser that isn't shackled to Easy Anti-Cheat.
It's HALO,need to say anything else?!

Great game! I started playing the Halo series in 2009, cementing a high level of love for this series permanently in my mind. With over 2000 hours in the series, I highly recommend multiplayer, either solo or with friends. Playing these games with friends brings back the nostalgia of coming home from a long day and playing all night. I will keep playing until I finally get all the achievements this game offers.
Haaah WORT WORT WORT......        Odomaa.
Wake me, When you need me.

Absolutely cannot recommend. Co-op campaign is unplayable, it constantly disconnects due to network errors and just hard boots you out of the mission. Solutions online suggest you verify integrity of game files (done), cap fps at 60 for all players (done), and finally reconfigure your router settings so that all players have an 'Open NAT'. I remember reconfiguring my router settings 15 years ago to play Halo 3 online, it is asinine that this is still an issue. The MCC was released in 2020 and yet even now network issues persist. Reading through the Steam discussions, these connection errors are very common. I would refund this game if I still could. It is a bare minimum ask that a multiplayer-oriented game have functional co-op multiplayer, which the MCC does not.

Trying to push political agendas and then banning anyone who disagrees is peak cringe.

Also, 4 years and the co-op netcode is still not fixed. I'd refund this wretched trashpile if i could.

Halo is one of a kind and has a special atmospheric and dynamic feel to it. Halo is Microsoft's baby, and if you love Microsoft, you will appreciate these games. Regardless if you are not a die-hard Microsoft fan, you will still get lost in the beauty of Halo. If you love sci-fi and one-of-a-kind shooters, then I totally recommend Halo to you.

- Frequent Blue Screens of Death, even after reinstall.
- Many unavoidable game-breaking bugs.
- Some levels literally unplayable, with a crash to desktop or permanent freeze at the start.
- Have to log in with a Microsoft account to play in any mode.

Shockingly bad experience, especially for a large company like Microsoft.
No local co-op on PC, gun audio is significantly worse than the originals
John Halo from Fortnite finally got his own spinoff game
It's amazing that I can play this on PC with controller support. A+ for this collection.
You do not own this game. You can not launch or play this game in offline mode
Nostalgia

The best gift for all those that love Halo <3 
Oh and you can play it Co-op! :D
look up "Master Chief teaches you how to play that cool halo riff on guitar"
Halo CE unplayable at the moment due to a memory leak for those with AMD GPUs. It's been a known issue since December 2022 and there has still been no updates in over half a year. Unacceptable.
The greatest 40$ I have ever spent
they put the mamsnrhbr chehfde in the soder

applist.name: Espresso Tycoon
applist.detailed_description:
MORE GAMES:

https://store.steampowered.com/app/1264390/Dreamjob_Programmer_Simulator__Learn_Programming_Games/
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1239320/Animal_Shelter/
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1573280/WW2_Rebuilder/


About the Game

https://store.steampowered.com/app/2394250/Rich_Dad_Simulator/
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1239320/Animal_Shelter/

JOIN OUR COMMUNITY!




Espresso Tycoon is a brand-new approach to the old classic tycoon games you remember from your childhood. Build a coffee shop from your dreams, where your customers can relax and drink delicious coffee. Deal with the emotional rollercoaster and build a successful coffee business.



Just imagine… you’re the boss here! Feel like the real cafe owner, an empire builder, and create the whole strategy, which includes:

  • decorating
  • hiring and managing employees
  • taking care of the supply chain
  • analyzing the budget
  • advertising your coffee shop
  • and, what’s most important, keeping your customers happy



You have your favorite coffee, right? So do your customers. Do the market research to find out their preferences. Use a 3D coffee editor to make different recipes to delight them. You can combine multiple ingredients in a very creative way.



Start, build and develop your coffee shop. Check your budget - do you have enough money to invest, or will you have to make some cuts? Decide where and when you want to start your new coffee business. Hire (or fire) a barista, do the marketing campaign, create a relaxing place, and collect the rating points.
Complete all the missions!



Are you a big fan of such games as Rollercoaster, pizza conection, planet coster? We are! Immerse yourself in the new coffee shop simulator. Build the best café in the city. Create, customize, sell snacks, cookie, and manage baristas– all of that in the new coffee shop simulation game. Become the coffee tycoon, don't feel stray, build the circle of trust with your customers, cross the frontier, and create the whole empire - the best on the planet!

You may think - 'let loose or work hard'? If you don't want to teardown your business - use your skills and try hard! You will see your prosperous coffee shop and you will say - 'What a satisfactory view!'. Do that in Espresso Tycoon - one of the best simulation games 2023! We may not be objective, but we really think so!

reviews.review:
Aaaahh espresso tycoon. A game I thought would be a joke or a goof or something badly made or not worth my time or money.

Well...I played it for a decent amount of time and came to a conclusion. 

At the very least it's worth it's asking price. It's not awful. Sure it's not perfect but in terms of simulator games it's actually pretty good.

The gameplay is fun and in depth although maybe a bit repetitive and sometimes boring.

Confusing right? I know but it's still the truth.

It has a lot, like choosing where to set up shop, customizing it in a lot of different ways including creating your own coffee recipes right down to what kind of cup you use or what kind of ice you use. Tons of different decorations and styles for your coffee shop and more.

It even has cutscenes, voice acting, a campaign story mode, a decent tutorial decent graphics and sound. I mean overall this game is pretty decent. That's the word of the day. DECENT.

The game is DECENT.

So it's worth your money and your time. But only if you're into simulator games with a lot of managing and sitting around watching things happen. If that doesn't sound interesting to you then you should probably pass on this one.

But I mean I liked it cuz I knew (more or less) what I was getting into. But it offered me far more than I was expecting which was really nice. If you'd like a more in depth look with gameplay then please check out the video on my YouTube Channel (link below).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m9lgH_cSnsM

Otherwise thanks for reading and I hope I managed to help some of you out there spend your money wisely.
reviews.developer_response:
We were very keen to find a rallying middle ground between the challenge of managing a cafe and having fun from the gameplay. I'm very happy that you think we succeeded!

And thank you for the video! It's great!

If you have any suggestions, or additional feedback after playing Espresso Tycoon - let us know!

reviews.review:
Great game !

Big AAA titles should learn from those guys, almost 10h in and zero bugs found. You pay exactly for what you get a relaxing and climatic coffee shop simulator.

The Latte Art is realy fun and satisfaing to use. I allways wanted to do something like that and now I can, maybe in a video game but still it counts :D 

Tutorial is simple and easy. What's more the campaing is engaging and I felt motivated to complete it to unlock levels in sandbox mode which by the way is even more fun :D UNLIMITED MONEY!!!!

Overall great game that you can easly play for houndres hours and don't get bored as there is a lot of customization. (I think you can use Latte Art allone for tens of hours)
reviews.developer_response:
Hi, thanks for such kind words!
I'm glad you like the game so much :) We put a lot of heart and work into this project, so we care that players have fun with gameplay :)
Show off what you were able to create by drawing Latte Art :D

P.S. Unlimited money - I wish it could be set so easily IRL :D

reviews.review: Takes grinding in games to a whole new level...
reviews.developer_response: Hi, thanks for your feedback! Will you say something more? Which location do you like the most? :)

reviews.review:
It's not a bad game: It's well polished, no bugs, good graphics, good AI, good animation, good models, good textures. The developers clearly put a lot of effort into this and it shows in every aspect of the final product.

I dislike the game because it's business and customer mechanics are very poorly fleshed out.
When you go to a coffee shop, you order your coffee how you like it, and the baristas make it how you like it.
What makes a coffee shop good is the beans, their staff, and what they are capable of making.

Espresso Tycoon chooses to boil down these ideas into "social classes", each of which will prefer an [i]exact specific drink[/i] and not order anything else. It is your job to create specialty drinks that directly appeal to each of the 8 social classes, or they won't order from your shop. The specialty drinks often involve mayonnaise, copious amounts of syrup and ice cream, and weird calorie/temp/caffeine criteria. 

I just don't think it's a good direction. The novelty of creating these beverages wears off after the first two or three, and it just ends up being a repetitive chore. We make our drinks and then we just... sit around and wait. yay.

The game is otherwise very well polished (better than some AAA games I've played recently...) and so I'm very confident future updates will be able to make the gameplay more engaging.
reviews.developer_response:
Hello!

Thank you for your feedback!

Thank you also for giving our game a chance.

In real life, we also have specific recipes in cafes, and we order them specifically. Whole chains of cafes have some recipes that they stick to, like the popular Pumpkin Spice Latte which is the same in every coffee shop all around the world.

In games, it is sometimes necessary to simplify certain aspects in order to develop the overall mechanics of the game. This means, in this case, making assumptions about whether customers will buy coffee made by players. We chose to use social groups as a solution, as it has proven successful in many classic games (such as Pizza Connection, which was one of our inspirations). However, I understand your point of view.

I'm curious, though, if you truly believe our game deserves a negative review, considering you've listed many advantages (for which I'm very grateful!). Is there anything we could improve that would change your opinion?

Thank you for your time!

reviews.review:
Instead of being dumped with a million different things to keep track of and learn right from the start, you progress in the missions a little at a time. You are not left wanting for more because each level is challenging in itself and it gets progressively harder and more in depth as you go. Its a great way to learn and to play at the same time without being overwhelmed or bored. I give this game a 9.5/10 so far and I've only just reached level 5 in the missions. 

         Then there is the sandbox mode. I have not yet tried this but I've heard from the developers themselves that you do not need to unlock anything in order to play it. Everything is already unlocked when you select this option. 

The music is relaxing. The graphics beautiful. The decoration options available are great. 

         Bring your creative juices, your own cup of beverage you desire and get ready to play for hours without realizing it. I highly recommend this game.
reviews.developer_response:
Wow! Thank you for such nice words!

We are very happy that the game, into which we put so much heart and energy, you liked so much!

If you have any ideas on what we should develop next, what we could improve - let us know. We would love to hear such suggestions!

reviews.review: I no longer needed other Tycoon game.
reviews.developer_response:
Am I to understand that you feel fulfilled and this is the kind of tycoon you needed? :D I hope I understand this correctly ;)
Do you have a favorite location?

reviews.review:
Someone worked in the coffee industry definitely helped create this game. While some aspects are truly "game play" mechanics, others are ripped straight out of a coffee shop manager's admin tasks. When I saw the gantt chart shift scheduling I was already having flashbacks to dealing with schedules in Kronos. Oh you need a second barista during peak? Look to hire. Oh, but Bobby can only work 4 hours and prefers evenings? Shift everyone else around to accommodate! And don't even get me started on allowing butter and mayo in coffee drinks! I simultaneously hate it and love it. The only critic I have is inventory management is a little clunky. It's nice that it give you a heads up when supply is running low, but I would love and end of day report or something that would just isolate the ingredients you currently order onto one page for quick mass reordering. I would also love and option for the store to autoclose when your barista leaves. The employees have schedules, why couldn't the shop have store hours? 

Final verdict: great game, you get exactly the experience you think you will get at the price you pay. A few quality of life improvements could help mechanics in the future, but gameplay is solid.
reviews.developer_response:
Hello!

Oh yes, we know what it's like to set schedules and many other aspects of working in food service.... :D
Mayonnaise for coffee, well - as you can see, some people like it, we couldn't deprive them of it in that case!

Thanks for the suggestions! We are now collecting feedback from players and will decide which features we will develop further and in what direction. We have our plan, but we want to verify it with what players expect.

Thanks again for your support and for your kind words!

Live long and prosper, Commander Spock!

reviews.review: Where have you bean all my life?
reviews.developer_response:
We have 'bean' very close, just making a game. But I'm glad we finally met :D

Will you say more about what you like about the game? Or do you have any ideas for further development? Let us know!

reviews.review: good game
reviews.developer_response:
Thank you so much! What do you like the most? If you have any ideas for the further development of the game - just let us know! You can write it here or complete the survey in the game.
We would love to hear that!

reviews.review: Many years I didn't saw tycoon game like Espresso Tycoon. This game have potential better than theme park series for sure. If you want have fun playing simulator game genre you need buy this game instantly.
reviews.developer_response: Wow! Thank you for such nice words! That's amazing - that you can really see how much work and heart we put into this project!

reviews.review: Sooooo relaxing.  Money management and boss simulator with no time hanging over your head. This game knows its audience and knows when to poke fun at itself. Have you played city sim games? Job sims? People sims? Yeah, its that with relaxing music, updated graphics, and intuitive systems. Well worth the money.
reviews.developer_response:
Hi!
We are glad that you can see how much heart and work we put into this game <3

And that comparison to the Sims - great! That was one of our inspirations, so we're glad you recognize it too.

If you have ideas on what we should develop further (in updates or DLC) - let us know!

reviews.review: been playing for almost 6 hours straight through the night, endless fun, endless options to create your very own espresso tycoon. I love how nostalgic this game feels yet there is by my own recollection nothing like it, and it has easily become a new favorite game of mine. If you enjoy management games with the option for sandbox/free build, and you love coffee, get the game, try it out, its truly a great one. I am hoping they will add more DLC in the future, as i would already drop $$$ on more content for this game! W Game Designers! Thank you for a great game that is fun and well made all around
reviews.developer_response:
Wow! You're so nice, thank you so much!

We sensed that the game might appeal to players, but such words are always impressive :D

Speaking of further development - if you have any suggestions and thoughts on what we should develop in updates and DLC - let us know, we'd love to hear!

reviews.review: Bought it on the release and I'm loving it: addictive coffeehouse simulator!
reviews.developer_response:
Hi, thank you for recommending our game! We appreciate it very much <3 And I'm glad you've been with us since release day!

Can you say something more? Do you prefer to play Missions or Sandbox?
Do you have your favorite location? :)

reviews.review: Very good and chill game
reviews.developer_response:
Hi!
Thank you for such nice words! What do you prefer - playing Campaign or the Sandbox mode? :)

reviews.review:
It is a very beautiful looking game. It has simple gameplay, mostly clicking for different tasks. 
There is campaign mode with 10 missions in 10 different locations which unlock different game features plus a sandbox mode where you can set up the goals and terms of your game in any of these locations. 
It is a relaxing game and not very hard to play and I like that. You won't need spend much time into it on a gameplay session unless you are into maximizing your profits, designing your coffee shops with tables and decorations and coffees themselves. 
The think the game takes some inspirations from Chef Life and Tavern Master which is good. It is worth the price in my opinion.
reviews.developer_response:
Thank you for such nice words! I really appreciate that!

It's true that we were inspired by a lot of classic tycoons when creating our game, so I'm glad you have such associations too :)

Do you have your favorite location? :)

reviews.review:
Fun game for not so big price (looking at current prices). 

Enjoyed the demo and enjoying the full game at the moment, creators added a few new features that were missing before and the whole game makes you feel a bit nostalgic if you played all those old tycoon games back in the day.
reviews.developer_response: Hi, thank you for such kind words! I'm glad that you like the game. We were inspired by classic tycoons (like RollerCoaster Tycoon, Pizza Connection - we're fans) while making this game, so I'm glad you see such a reference here too. Do you have any of your favorite locations? Do you prefer to play missions or Sandbox mode? :)

applist.name: UNO
applist.detailed_description:
One of the most iconic classic games which we all grew to know and love! UNO makes its return with an assortment of exciting new features such as added video chat support and an all new theme system which adds more fun!
Match cards either by matching color or value and play action cards to change things up. Race against others to empty your hand before everyone else in either Classic play or customize your experience with a variety of House Rules and match settings to ensure you and your friends never play the same game twice!
Also, get ready to shake things up with new branded themes introducing never-before-seen Theme Cards that really change the way you play the game!

applist.name: Jagged Alliance 3
applist.detailed_description:
Grand Chien, a nation of rich natural resources and deep political divides, is thrown into chaos when the elected president goes missing and a paramilitary force known as “The Legion” seizes control of the countryside. Now, the President’s family has pulled together all their resources, including an arrangement with the powerful Adonis corporation, to hire a group of skilled mercenaries tasked with finding the President and bringing order back to the country.

In Jagged Alliance 3, select from a huge cast of mercenaries all with their own unique personalities, quirks, and backstories. Then go out and explore Grand Chien as you meet new people, earn money, grow your team, and ultimately make your own decisions that will decide the country’s fate.

FEATURES

  • Engage in rich, tactical turn-based combat
  • Recruit from a large cast of unique mercenaries, including many familiar fan favorites
  • Loot, salvage, and customize an arsenal of weaponry and equipment
  • Choose from a wide array of special perks to customize your mercs as they level up
  • Decide the fate of Grand Chien in an open RPG structure
  • Control territory, train the locals, command multiple parties, and defend against enemy forces in an alive, active world
  • Experience the campaign with friends in online co-op mode

applist.name: Devil May Cry 5
applist.detailed_description:
Devil May Cry 5 + Vergil

Лучший охотник на демонов возвращается в новом стильном боевике. Теперь в издание входит скачиваемый контент для игрового персонажа Вергилия (также доступен отдельно).

В пятой части легендарной серии Devil May Cry вы вновь сможете насладиться сверхскоростными сражениями с участием невероятных персонажей. Новейшие технологии компьютерной графики позволили Capcom создать этот непревзойденный шедевр жанра экшен.

Ознакомьтесь с составом купленного ранее контента, чтобы избежать повторной покупки.


Devil May Cry 5 Deluxe + Vergil

Издание Deluxe Edition включает полную версию игры, игрового персонажа Вергилия (доступен отдельно) и следующий дополнительный контент:

- Бичи дьявола: Гербера GP01, Бич пасты, Плен чувств, Мегабластер
- Оружие Данте: Кавалерия R
- Боевая музыка: по три композиции из Devil May Cry, Devil May Cry 2, Devil May Cry 3 и Devil May Cry 4
- Альт. голоса: дикторы рангов стилей, заставки
- Ролики с живыми актерами

Примечание. Часть контента доступна начиная со второй миссии. Чтобы воспользоваться Кавалерией R (оружием Данте), сначала нужно получить Кавалерию в игре. Видеоролики с живыми актерами озвучены только на японском языке.

Ознакомьтесь с составом купленного ранее контента, чтобы избежать повторной покупки.


Издание Digital Deluxe Edition


Об игре

В пятой части легендарной серии Devil May Cry вы вновь сможете насладиться сверхскоростными сражениями с участием невероятных персонажей. Новейшие технологии компьютерной графики позволили Capcom создать этот непревзойденный шедевр жанра экшен.

applist.detailed_description:
Comparative Grid


Deluxe Edition



Includes the game and Ultimate Pack, which contains four packs and 20 Helicopter Tickets.


Gold Edition



Receive the game and Y1 Pass with the Gold Edition and jump into the Riders Republic™ massive multiplayer playground!


Ultimate Edition



Ride in style with the Ultimate Edition, which includes the Year 1 Pass and four exclusive style packs.


About the Game

Jump into the Riders Republic™ massive multiplayer playground! Grab your bike, skis, snowboard, or wingsuit and explore an open world sports paradise where the rules are yours to make—or break.

- Battle against over 50 players simultaneously in a massive multiplayer playground.
- Compete in an all-out mass start race—collide, grind, and fight your way to the finish!
- Customize your character to show off your style to your friends or show up the competition.

- Go wild on the heights of iconic US national parks like Yosemite, Zion, and Bryce Canyon.

applist.name: Astro Colony
applist.detailed_description:
Join Our Community


About the Game


Astro Colony is a game of automation and exploration in an infinite procedurally generated universe. It is composed of fully destructible voxel planets.



Move stations, dock them and create a galaxy network no one have seen before!


A space adventure game could not exist without a variety of biomes and hundreds of plants!


Construct unique transport systems using conveyor belts and pipes.


Recruit new Astronauts and fulfill their needs by providing food and shelter.


Research over 70 unique technologies to progress in colony development.


Play the game in the co-op mode with your friends or join other hosted lobbies.


Traverse the universe full of unexpected events and discover unknown grounds.
But be aware, the danger is lurking around the corner!

reviews.review: I played before Josh.  If you know, you know.

I got this on sale for $15 after watching "Let's Game it Out" play it. 
And it looks fun and it can be kinda fun but the game is.... not the greatest.

I was genuinely expecting a Factorio game in space and to some degree it delivers on that... but poorly.

Since the way you are going to get a constant supply of automated minerals relies on RANDOM asteroid catching... you are going to have mixed resources. The game is heavily focused on you moving your colony around and manually setting up very temporary drills. In Satisfactory or Factorio 1 drill can last you an insane amount of time with the former lasting forever. Here, that doesn't apply. Drills have to be repeatedly moved regularly and that sucks, the core concept seems it really wants you to constantly move across the universe and stopping when you see big islands and setting up. 

Then there is another negative with how much of the same material is out right needed in all production and how much it gets cycled back. In Satisfactory or Factorio it felt like a progress of the use of minerals... here it feels like an endless loop and dance and since the only constant supply is literally random minerals it makes it very annoying to setup a layout in a way I'd prefer.

This game had a lot of promise for me and I enjoyed it for what I spent on it but overall I just don't see it improving to a point where I'd personally recommend it to other friends who thoroughly enjoy Satisfactory or Factorio and love space like I do.


EDIT: 
It is so incredibly hard to put into words how this doesn't really line up and give an enjoyable experience. Part of the problem is there IS automation but the automation is.... annoying and still requires a lot of manual effort to maintain. Even if you are able to come up with a design the filters and splits.... new problems occur. It isn't really a fun problem to solve. In Factorio and Satisfactory there is an absolute feeling of progressing with materials that doesn't require insane juggling early on. Here.... I feel like it is just a constant juggle even from the start and it never seems to end in an experience that feels smooth. That and the research is not a slow research... its fast... so fast I don't even see the point of why it is setup like it is. In 10 mins you will research like 10 different things confusing the hell out of what you just really learned and how to utilize it. In the short time I played I have researched over 40+ things.... it is overly complicated design and when you complete the research it doesn't feel like it really applies to anything for a bit but just BASIC unlocks, which isn't bad but with how much it is it is just all over the place. 

For example, once I researched smelting. I thought there would be a little bit of time understanding it and more mechanics INVOLVED with it.... but within literal minutes you are already learning the thing after that and the thing after that and the thing after that... now you have to have fun plugging it all in.... 

Idk its just so many things are all over the place in this game for me and it just isn't for me.
reviews.developer_response:
Hi
(N☆G) Jackal ★JJ★

Thank you for your comment

No, it's not RANDOM
Community requested a feature for Automated Catcher to select resources to catch. You can decide what resources you want to catch.

CORE CONCEPT
It's the game about exploration, so it's a challenge where you need to find resources (more advanced) since you can use asteroid catchers for others.

LOGISTICS
There are logic blocks which are quite entertaining, allowing to design an efficient space station. Once again, it's a challenge, but it's really rewarding.

PROGRESSION
There is no rush to go on with every single research. Some players are taking time to scale production first, making 10 automated catchers before moving on.

Thank you for your observations. Could you please share how would you make progression more enjoyable?

Kind regards,
Tefel

reviews.review: My number one rule for early access games is not to buy them unless I would be happy with the development ending at point of purchase. Astro Colony has enough content at this point in development that I feel you would not be disappointed in your purchase if you bought it now and nothing new was ever added. Any new additions are going to be an added bonus in my eyes.
The game still needs more time in the oven. It's not quite a "factory" game yet, it's not a space sim or survival game. I'm not sure what the colony part is supposed to be, either.
reviews.developer_response:
Hi Soylent,
Thanks for your review.

Any suggestions, what is still missing for a "factory" game?
It's quite well optimized with plenty of QOL and automation mechanics.
There is even a multiplayer which will be improved soon with dedicated servers.

The blueprint system was the most requested feature, so that's why it came first.
I know that instead of adding architecture I could focus more on end-game, multiplayer and colony-sim part, but that's coming next, don't worry.

Kind regards,
Tefel

reviews.review:
Tried this out because lets game it out made it look... a lot easier to navigate than it is in reality.

My main issue I'm having is the amount of clicking back and forth from the inventory menu that I'm having to do just to maintain the stuff in my inventory through hand crafting. This is really easily solvable, all we would need is the ability to have a "Maintain X copper wire" setting instead of only having "always craft copper wire" and "Craft X copper wire 1 time." Copper wire is just the example, of course, this setting should exist for all materials.

I also wish the oxygen production was a bit more straightforward, the first thing you learn to craft is the oxygen machine, but it doesn't actually do anything except eat ice that you input manually until much later on after you spend a lot more research points.

The game looks like it could be something  someday, after a lot more work has gone into QOL but right now I couldn't really get into it for the simple fact that I was completely turned off by the early game inventory management.

In response to the developer:

I'm going to assume there is a language barrier because you don't seem to understand what I meant in my first paragraph about maintaining X resources. 

What is currently there is a 1 time build order. This is fine if you don't mind going back to make more build orders once your resources run out, however during the early game resources are constantly running out. What I am suggesting is a build order to always craft up to X amount of a resource when its parent resources are available. For example, you can always set ingots to produce infinitely, but once you start crafting wires, you need to make sure you aren't running out of ingots. Ideally you could tell the hand craft menu to always produce iron bars, and to craft up to 10 iron wire, no more than that, forever. This ensures that you always have some iron wire and some iron ingots, I hope that is clearer.

Admittedly I missed the "move" command, so I will remove that from the review. 

I get that you're probably sick of hearing QOL in negative reviews, but there's definitely a reason you keep hearing it. Overall, doing things in the game just feels clunky, whether it is inventory management or resource management, it just feels like a chore to do stuff rather than a game. Not trying to be harsh, but I don't need to spend 50 hours in a game to know that I'm going to enjoy playing more of it. If I see things added in the patch notes farther down the line, I will come back because I think you have something with this game, it's just not there yet.
reviews.developer_response:
Hi Smoolz,
Thanks for trying out Astro Colony!

There is already an option to do X craftings which works exactly what you suggested. You press "I want 10 copper bars" and the recipe disables when it crafts 10 copper bars.

MOVING once again is in the game - you simply remove and place it back without paying a cost.

There are already 2 years of adding QOL, so I wish you can spend a little bit more time with a game to discover them.

Kind Regards,
Tefel

reviews.review:
If you like games like Satisfactory, Subnautica, Raft and Rimworld; Astro Colony is the game for you. This survival mining game takes you to outer space where you must gather resources and build a thriving space colony. 

On first play through I played 10 hours straight without even realizing it. The game really pulls you in how much there is to do. Build and modify the space station however you like. The game has a sandbox mode, single player and multiplayer. 

This early access game shows much promise and potential in survival crafting games alike. 

And if you still aren't convinced, check out Let's game it out on Youtube

This game is great! I still having alot of fun with it.  Being able to move your station viturally anywhere in the games universe along with space hazards to avoid like comets, meteors, lighning storms and of course blackholes that will suck your station in if you get too close to it. While the game is still under heavy development its is already showing good potential of being a great game.
As a cross between Raft (IN SPACE!) and Satisfactory, this is a must have for any "automation" fans.

First crash after about 20 minutes of play, here's my evaluation so far:

Pros:
- Really large sandbox environment with a central hub (really similar to the game Raft, minus the danger from leaving the base to collect resources)
- Good amount of processes and base items, with a long research tree
- Graphics are decent, and gameplay is relatively smooth
- Tutorial is optional, but good enough to teach you the very basics of gameplay
- Progression loop is fun and rewarding (collect things by hand, begin automating production, go out for more/different resources, etc)

Cons:
- As mentioned above, I crashed only twenty minutes into play. User experience may vary, but on my platform I also had occasional stuttering.
- QOL is very scant, navigating menus is a nightmare, handcrafting defaults to endless production of individual items, placing floating objects do not snap to connection points, controls by default aren't intuitive and required a decent bit of remapping

Overall: Decent quality for early access, not really worth buying at present but has a ton of potential to be as good as similar sandbox factory games.

(Shoutout to LGIO)
This is an iffy positive review with some constructive criticism based on my 6 hours of playtime. I have yet to get to late game, so I'll probably update this later.

The good:
- It's a factory game and factory games are fun
- The base structures of automation are there
- Colonists being part of the ecosystem is pretty cool, though not very fleshed out
- Flying around and collecting islands/planetoids is cool as shit
- Starting out with freedom of movement is wonderful

The not so good:
- Some basic QOL is missing:
- Default hotkeys are absolutely awful. They ideally would utilize only my left hand so I don't have to constantly take my hand off my mouse to hit keys. This should be done with CTRL/SHIFT modifiers where necessary. Both construction and inventory require you do this and they're both extremely common. Like why?
- Mass deleting should just use Ctrl + Right Click, or whatever you have bound to the single destroy hotkey instead of a separate key. There is no instance where I'm highlighting stuff and would want to delete a separate item.
- The biggest one that some others have mentioned: logistics does not feel good to use. The fact that machines have no capacity limits means that instead of just dropping down easy pushers, you have to fiddle with splitter ratios. I don't want to set custom ratios for every machine. I'd prefer to set up a saturated main bus and branch off where necessary without having to worry about proper ratios. I'm dreading redoing/expanding my base just because of how boring it will be to set up all the splitter ratios. Maybe I'm missing something here, in which case I'd love if someone could enlighten me.

The neutral/personal desires:
- I wish flooring was somehow cheaper or the starting colony area was larger. Early game can be quite grindy when you start running out of space. 1 plate per tiny floor piece is not too expensive, but it adds up quickly with how large all the machines are.
- I'd love a pickaxe upgrade somewhere. Unlocking nuclear fusion and still mining stuff at the same speed as the beginning doesn't make much sense.
- I probably just haven't unlocked it/seen it yet, but basic belts are really slow. The dev has mentioned in other comments how unused materials can just get passed through machines, but this isn't really feasible when belts get clogged so easily.
- In 2 player multiplayer the bot/tutorials only show up for the host and not for the other person. I assume this is already planned to be fixed since multiplayer is mentioned as being barebones.

I'm enjoying the game so far and will probably get my money's worth, but I hope the dev can implement some more QOL stuff so the game doesn't feel quite as janky.

The developer truly cares about the success of the game , so I know the game will be always be supported. 

BUY the game - Cannot wait for the future updates!
reviews.developer_response:
Hi Rob,

Thanks for your support!

There is an upcoming Major update around the corner, currently being tested in the test branch.

Kind regards,
Terad Games

reviews.review: really fun game. some desync with multiplayer but its not terrible. everything else about the game is fun and it regularly gets updated. latest update was a big one

applist.name: Undead Citadel
applist.detailed_description:
ADD OUR GAME ON YOUR WISHLIST AND/OR FOLLOW US!


About the Game

Exclusive for VR, UNDEAD CITADEL immerses you into an adventure encountering hundreds of Undead in breathtaking combats crammed with numerous foes. Slash, stab, crush, shoot or dismember with your own hands, as you find the way into the depths of the cursed citadel.



COMBAT CHARACTERISTICS

  • 100% physics-based combat system
    • Prioritizes the player's 1:1 movement for total combat control.
    • There is barely any delay between your real and virtual hand.
    • Experience realistic physics when you slash, stab or simply destabilize your enemy.

  • Loads of weapons and potions
    • Over 60 hand-to-hand combat weapons, including swords, axes, war hammers, maces, shields, two-handed weapons, etc.
    • Bows, arrows and explosives for ranged attacks.
    • Each type of weapon has unique characteristics. Use them intuitively!
    • Look at their strength and durability attributes to decide on which ones to keep.
    • Find and use slow motion, strength, or freeze potions to mutate your power and obliterate the living dead.



  • Dozens of different enemies
    • Confront the Undead in different states of decomposition.
    • Before you attack, be aware of their armor, protection and weapon type.
    • Dodge or block their attacks with your weapon, find their weak spot and deliver a mortal blow.
    • Keep their weapons! They won’t need them anymore.



GAME MODES

  • Story Mode
    • Travel across a fantastic setting with over 10 levels and discover the origins of the plague.
    • Explore the exterior of the citadel and its many interiors while searching for hidden items.
    • Solve puzzles in different scenarios to advance the story.
  • Horde Mode
    • Survive the endless enemy hordes for as long as possible.
    • Reach the top of the different leaderboards (score, decapitations, etc.)
  • Armory
    • Collect all the weapons you acquire from the other modes in your armory.
    • Practice and experiment with your vast collection in this sandbox mode.

MOVEMENT

  • Various options for moving around
    • Smooth locomotion with instant turning.
    • Smooth locomotion with smooth turning.

reviews.review: Well worth the wait, a little laggy at times but I think that might be because I'm using an oculus quest 2. This game is awesome. The combat is satisfying and clean and the visuals are really well done. Good job devs the wait was worth it!

My rig: Valve Index, RTX 3090, i9 10900K (10cores/20threads, 5.3Ghz), 32GB 3200 Mhz, Win10 Pro. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2986614646
Using Ultra settings, this game is demanding, but you got great real-time lighting and detailed dynamic shadows - and surfaces look like using bump-mapped textures. The HDR-like lighting looks awesome, not sure I've seen it better in any other VR game:

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2986612315
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2986610579
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2986614346

The best I could do was to max out all graphics settings in-game (leave res slider at 1.0), select Index res 225% in 80 Hz and disable motion smoothing. Then I had solid 80 fps - but I'm only 1.5 hours into the game. 

The fighting is better in HellSplit, in Undead Citadel it feels like there's some latency to sword swinging, which devs may have done to simulate some weight and (lack of) precision.

I do love the voice actor behind this game - this is a game for adults. 

You can enter nearly all houses/buildings, in great contrast to many other similar games close to no door is locked in the Citadel  (ok, some doors are, but then you can unlock the door and enter). This is a real VR game, made from the ground up for PCVR. You can interact with most objects, physics work great. You can move chairs, lift barrels, light candles to light a dark room, and you can pick up most items:

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2986614016

Sure, Vertigo 2 still is the best game in 2023, but if you're into sword fighting, Undead Citadel may be the better choice. Note that the game is easy for Blade and Sorcery veterans, in that case choose the hardest level of difficulty. 

For now 8/10 to me. 9/10 if latency on sword swinging is lowered.

from what ive played so far the game is really cool but the combat needs alot of work still enemies feel like stuffed animals, not much impact when hitting the enemies, some of the weapon textures needs work picked up a great sword and the handle looked like a lego block,hands can be janky at times,besides that great game with alot of potential hopefully the devs dont let this game die.
I wish I liked this game but with lag, bugs, and the game overall being unpolished I cannot recommend Undead Citadel
After playing a lot of B&S and battle talent it took me a while to get into the combat but now I’m loving it- the character animations are really good.lots of atmosphere!

Good game 
Played it till the third level and a round of the horde mode, I think the Physics and the fighting is pretty Solid, but sometimes It felt a bit like a look through all houses simulator even ofc it was my decision to try finding hidden things inside of them.

But yea me likey good game, cant wait for Multiplayer if that actually comes :3

applist.name: Kingdom Come: Deliverance
applist.detailed_description:
Special Offer


About the Game

Game:

You're Henry, the son of a blacksmith. Thrust into a raging civil war, you watch helplessly as invaders storm your village and slaughter your friends and family. Narrowly escaping the brutal attack, you grab your sword to fight back. Avenge the death of your parents and help repel the invading forces!

Story:

Bohemia – located in the heart of Europe, the region is rich in culture, silver, and sprawling castles. The death of its beloved ruler, Emperor Charles IV, has plunged the kingdom into dark times: war, corruption, and discord are tearing this jewel of the Holy Roman Empire apart.

One of Charles' sons, Wenceslas, has inherited the crown. Unlike his father, Wenceslas is a naive, self-indulgent, unambitious monarch. His half-brother and King of Hungary, Sigismund the Red Fox, senses weakness in Wenceslas. Feigning good will, Sigismund travels to Bohemia and kidnaps his half-brother. With no king on the throne, Sigismund is now free to plunder Bohemia and seize its riches.

In the midst of this chaos, you're Henry, the son of a blacksmith. Your peaceful life is shattered when a mercenary raid, ordered by King Sigismund himself, burns your village to the ground. By bittersweet fortune, you are one of the few survivors of this massacre.

Without a home, family, or future you end up in the service of Lord Radzig Kobyla, who is forming a resistance against the invasion. Fate drags you into this bloody conflict and shoves you into a raging civil war, where you help fight for the future of Bohemia.

Features:

  • Massive realistic open world: Majestic castles, vast fields, all rendered in stunning high-end graphics.
  • Non-linear story: Solve quests in multiple ways, then face the consequences of your decisions.
  • Challenging combat: Distance, stealth, or melee. Choose your weapons and execute dozens of unique combos in battles that are as thrilling as they are merciless.
  • Character development: Improve your skills, earn new perks, and forge and upgrade your equipment.
  • Dynamic world: Your actions influence the reactions of the people around you. Fight, steal, seduce, threaten, persuade, or bribe. It’s all up to you.
  • Historical accuracy: Meet real historical characters and experience the genuine look and feel of medieval Bohemia.

reviews.review:
Masterpiece 

and challenging combat

Riddled with bugs and glitches but can do whatever you want in the game so there are a lot of variables to consider.

Wonderful game. Got the royal edition on a steam sale for 12.00, and originally hated it, downloaded it, died about 30 times in the first 10 minutes of the game and deleted it considering it a wasted 12 dollars. A few months later i looked into it and found that you're supposed to be inept in the beginning and that you gradually get better as your character learns more moves. You may know what to do in a fight, but Henry is a Blacksmith's son, he doesn't. You arent special, or born to be great, you're a nobody.
 Redownloaded  and took my time to learn gameplay and practicing skills. Love it, the realism to the learning curve of combat and subtle additions like "learning to read." Great game, I highly recommend it.

A great game, despite the occasional bugs and glitches, the game is really fun. HOWEVER, BE WARNED, THE GAME DOES REQUIRE YOU TO BE PATIENT WITH IT, you get to watch yourself and the protagonist slowly develop as a character and combatant as well as you develop in mechanics.

For a small studio I really do commend their work, I'm nowhere near European decent nor christian but I went to the game with an open mind and because I like history and do know a thing or two about medieval history  and was quite satisfied with it, the world and atmosphere are amazing, side quests and DLCs can keep the game up to 120hrs+ but after you finish those there is little to do in this game and you either start a new game or just quit and forget about it until the next time you open it. 

Overall I give this game a solid 8 out of 10 and I would recommend it.
Jesus Christ be praised.

I remember playing the [i]Kingdom Come: Deliverance[/i] demo a few years ago, it was really sturdy and it barely worked. When the full version released I was very sceptical about the game, especially given that reviews were talking about many technical problems. [b]After all [i]KC:D[/i] turned out to be a masterpiece.[/b]

I have played this game 3 times, every playthrough was giving me more fun and joy. [i]Kingdome Come: Deliverence[/i] is a very well-writen RPG with rich characters and dialogue. You won't experience dull, storyless missions in it. [b]The best parts about the game are the graphics and level design. They are gorgeous![/b]

[b]If you have not tried this game before - now is the time![/b]

The immersive experience you get from playing this game is truly profound. It's astonishing how everything, from the captivating story to the engaging side missions and the rich character dialogue, comes together so flawlessly. This game is a masterpiece.

[h1]Kingdom Come: Deliverance - A Gritty and Realistic Medieval RPG[/h1]

[h2]Visuals[/h2]
Immerse yourself in the meticulously recreated medieval world of Kingdom Come: Deliverance. The game's visuals strive for realism, presenting a historically accurate depiction of 15th-century Bohemia. From sprawling landscapes to meticulously designed castles and villages, every detail is crafted with precision and authenticity. The attention to historical accuracy in the visuals transports you back in time, creating a truly immersive and visually stunning experience.

[h2]Gameplay[/h2]
Embark on a realistic and immersive medieval RPG experience in Kingdom Come: Deliverance. As a humble blacksmith's son, you'll navigate a world filled with political intrigue, epic battles, and personal quests for redemption. The gameplay emphasizes realism, requiring you to engage in realistic combat, manage your character's needs, and make decisions that have lasting consequences. The immersive open-world exploration, deep character development, and branching quests offer a rich and engaging gameplay experience.

[h2]Realism and Historical Accuracy[/h2]
Kingdom Come: Deliverance prides itself on its commitment to historical accuracy and realism. The game meticulously recreates the customs, culture, and hardships of medieval life, offering a unique and authentic experience. From the realistic combat system, where every swing and parry matters, to the attention to detail in the clothing, architecture, and social hierarchies, the game's commitment to realism immerses you in a world that feels alive and historically grounded.

[h2]Compelling Storyline[/h2]
The narrative of Kingdom Come: Deliverance is a compelling and intricately woven tale. As you navigate the political landscape and unravel the secrets of your character's past, you'll encounter memorable characters, engage in morally ambiguous choices, and experience the consequences of your actions. The storyline is immersive, filled with rich dialogue, and steeped in historical context. It's a story that keeps you engaged and invested, offering a sense of purpose and urgency as you progress.

[h2]Immersive Sound Design[/h2]
The sound design of Kingdom Come: Deliverance adds depth and realism to the game. The ambient sounds of nature, bustling villages, and clashing swords create a sense of immersion and authenticity. The voice acting is superb, bringing the characters to life with convincing performances. The evocative musical score sets the tone for each moment, heightening the emotional impact of the story and the intensity of the gameplay.

In summary, Kingdom Come: Deliverance offers a gritty and realistic medieval RPG experience. With its stunning visuals, immersive gameplay, commitment to historical accuracy, compelling storyline, and immersive sound design, it stands as a standout title in the genre. If you're a fan of immersive RPGs and crave a deep and authentic medieval experience, Kingdom Come: Deliverance is a game that should not be missed. Prepare to be transported to a meticulously recreated medieval world and embark on an epic journey of adventure, intrigue, and personal growth.

You can meet a cool priest who really makes you wish modern christianity was more influenced by ppl like him.

also its a cool game about olden times, really usefull if you try to run a low magic D&D campaign.

Overall pretty fun game, interesting story, generally fun gameplay
a few gripes but not enough to stop me playing cause im enjoying the game overall

combat
The combat is a pain in the fucking ass. It can become more fun, once you grind up the combat levels to the point that no longer can every peasant with a rusty shovel master strike all of your hits and endlessly slap you in the face. The combat forces you to play EXTREMELY defensively, if you attack most of your hits will be parried or countered by whats referred to as a master strike, a counter that is unblockable. Once you get to higher levels you actually have a chance of being offensive and going after hits without all attacks being blocked or countered, but that will only be much later on in the game.

Story
The story is pretty interesting, got me hooked quite quickly and a lot of the background characters are quite good, the vast majority seeming like real people and not just npcs there for the main quest. While it can be a pain in the ass that you didnt realise a quest was timed, actually having pressure to finish quests before you have negative consequences are pretty fun (by timed i mean you have like, a few in game days to complete them theres no 10 minute timers or whatever to finish a quest once you start it).
My main gripe with the story is just how much I dislike henry as a character, being a voiced main character with an actual story you're roughly meant to follow does mean that his character and choices are pretty limited to the person that henry is, but the problem is I dont really like henry all that much as a person. you can try your best to play honourable and be nice to people but at the end of the day henrys character is based around a slobish drunk thats massively hotheaded. More of a personal gripe than anything so you'd have to play for yourself and see how you like him but im still not the biggest fan, the amount he fucking wags his finger at people >:I

bugs
Ah yes, its the modern day and almost all games come out in an unplayable state when several game breaking bugs for players to discover right after launch, good thing for you if you're reading this, its been a long time since this game launched. There are a few bugs in the game but most of them are minor, a small sidequest not giving you a small cash reward, one of the quests having a bugged speech check (you dont fail the quest but you do end up in jail for a short period, ive seen on the wiki that its claimed to be bugged so this isnt me just failing the speech check for magic reasons). But overall the game is pretty bug free so you shouldnt have any worries

at the end of the day as stated at the start, overall a pretty good game and I recommend playing it

Kingdom Come: Deliverance is easily one of the best RPGs I've ever played. The story is fascinating in depth (not least because of the historical setting) and sprawling in scope.  The extensive non-combat options and open-ended quest solutions alongside the (initially awkward) difficult melee combat encourage diverse playstyles. Make no mistake. Kingdom Come: Deliverance is definitely a slow-burner. The main story itself takes a couple of hours before fully emerging. The various skills also require a good amount of practice before you're even close to mastery. The payoff is more than worth it, with all skills being extremely satisfying to pull off once mastered. 

The locations feel alive and all the villages have their own distinctive feel. Traveling is a joy and the forests are simply breathtaking. They feel real and dense. There are picturesque places and they are not few and far between. This means that the game is not mindless traveling between activity/quest to activity/quest. Locations need to be revisited fairly frequently and the map is not terribly large. This turns out to be an advantage to the game, eschewing a focus on transport mechanics and instead developing lots of environmental interaction.

The artwork deserves a special mention for its intricate and informative inclusion. In the in-game murals, the loading screens, character screens, and the like, the artwork is detailed and immerses the player in the time and place. The Codex is a lovely addition, giving basic historical information on the main locations, characters, events, etc. The sound design is splendid with brilliant and immersive voice acting and very moving and memorable pieces in the soundtrack.

The central characters are well-fleshed out and ambiguous enough to feel human (and not a caricature). The DLCs add to the existing characters quite a bit (especially recommend A Woman's Lot and The Amorous Adventures of Bold Sir Hans Capon) and the others are nice little additions (From the Ashes is a mini-city management quest). The only places where I can hope for improvement are the somewhat under-explored politics of the time (only emerging towards the end as the main character is finally politically entangled with Sigismund's invasion) and the slightly uniform nature of non-central NPCs. The Cumans are under-explored as characters (as almost no dialogue is possible, they become a caricature-like invading force of foreign mercenaries). More complex interactions with prominent non-Czech characters and non-combatant Czechs would be welcome.  Related to this is the slightly under-emphasized area of the role of non-combatant characters in the political struggle. Jan Hus' reformist ideas are on display in a key quest but the religious conflict of the time, especially premonitions of the Hussite war, feels somewhat diminished in the game.

Other technical aspects like the bugs and rendering problems have been largely fixed, with only the occasional getting stuck in the gap between rocks and needing to fiddle with the jump button before getting out.

Overall, I highly recommend Kingdom Come: Deliverance to any RPG fan, historical game fan, or even anyone wanting to play a highly immersive story. Warhorse, on the whole, has done a stellar job with this game. I am absolutely keeping my eye out for a sequel.
