JACQUES DE MOLAY YOU HAVE BEEN AVENGED!! 🇫🇷🇫🇷🇫🇷🙏🙏

ONE OF THE GREATEST GAMES OF ALL TIME!! OUI OUI HON HON! I LOVE ARNO, BELLEC, NAPOLEON, AND GERMAIN!! GOATED CHARACTERS FR! 

Perfect, rich setting of the french revolution, fully realized like never before! Absolutely stunning graphics (the baked lighting is just 😽😽😽). The story is solid, the cast is cool (Bellec habibi is Desmond’s ancestor so that’s great, too) and i loved running around paris and meeting my bff Napoleon Bonaparte himself (i loved his chemistry with Arno… then again, who wouldn’t?! he’s the Leonardo da vinci to Arno’s Ezio here) This is AC gameplay at its PEAK. 

@ubisoft WHERE is my arno sequel i demand it right now goddammit

First and foremost, the best thing about the game is the open world. They did an amazing job designing 18th century Paris with all the iconic buildings and historical locations. The city is so lively thanks to the crowd system tech they’ve used to create large populations. I spent much of my time simply exploring and enjoying the sights.

But other than that…everything else is just plain dull. The story is mediocre and Arno Dorian is one of the least interesting AC protagonists I’ve seen. The side characters and the villains are just as bland. The mission design is so boring and lacklustre, I had to practically drag myself through the game to finish it. 

The new parkour system was extremely frustrating and sometimes not even responsive. Maybe there’s a learning curve to it, but I sure didn’t find it myself. The improved combat system is pretty decent and added some good difficulty to the gameplay.

The new customization options were fun. We get to change each clothing piece individually to create a unique look for Arno. There’re unlockable upgrades and skills as well. Some of them are pretty useful like the ability to disguise. Then there are redundant ones like environmental blending; why does Arno need to UNLOCK the ability to SIT on a bench? 

There are some interesting side missions such as Paris stories and murder mysteries. The Co-Op missions were enjoyable; there’s still a decent player base so it wasn’t difficult to find people to play with.

While writing this I still couldn't decide whether I would recommend this or not. So I’ll just say try it out when it's dirt cheap on sale. If you’re going through the series for the overarching storyline, this is easily skippable, as nothing significant happens in this game.
Awesome Game Love Arno

Graphics are great and it runs decently , i really want to complete this game but the draw distance for some reason is very less (like 2-3 feet away from the character on ultra high settings), and i can't really stand the texture and NPC pop ins .

Also there is no option to start a new game.

This is probably one of the best Assassin Creed games ever made. The graphics are outstanding, the story is amazing and the game play and fun factor is all present here. Unity does upgrades right, I actually want to loot enemies and steal their stuff. This game is fun single player or online co-op. Beautiful structures to climb and the parkour has never been better. This is Assassins Creed at it's best!!

Advantages:

Immersive Historical Setting: "Assassin's Creed: Unity" transports players to the vibrant and detailed world of 18th-century Paris during the French Revolution. The game beautifully captures the atmosphere, architecture, and culture of the time, offering an authentic and immersive historical experience.
Stunning Visuals: The game features breathtaking visuals, from the intricate details of the city to the character models and animations. The attention to historical accuracy and visual fidelity enhances the overall immersion and makes exploring the open-world environment a visual treat.
Parkour and Navigation: The parkour and navigation mechanics in "Assassin's Creed: Unity" are refined and fluid, allowing players to effortlessly traverse the city rooftops, climb structures, and perform impressive acrobatic movements. The improved parkour system adds to the sense of being a skilled assassin.
Co-op Multiplayer: The inclusion of cooperative multiplayer is a notable feature of "Assassin's Creed: Unity." Players can team up with friends to tackle missions and explore the game world together, adding a social aspect to the gameplay experience.
Disadvantages:

Technical Issues: Upon release, "Assassin's Creed: Unity" was plagued by technical problems, including performance issues, glitches, and bugs. While many of these issues were patched in subsequent updates, the initial launch experienced significant problems, impacting the game's overall stability.
Limited AI and Stealth Mechanics: Some players felt that the enemy AI in the game was lacking depth, making stealth gameplay less challenging and rewarding. The stealth mechanics, while improved from previous entries, still fell short of expectations for some players seeking more nuanced and complex stealth experiences.
Narrative and Character Development: While the game's historical setting and events are captivating, some players found the main narrative and character development in "Assassin's Creed: Unity" to be weaker compared to other entries in the series. The story may not have resonated as strongly, and character arcs may have felt less compelling for certain players.
Repetitive Side Missions: The game features a wide range of side missions, but some players criticized them for feeling repetitive and lacking variety. The side content, while offering additional activities, did not always provide unique or engaging experiences for some players.
It's important to note that these strengths and weaknesses are subjective and may vary depending on individual preferences and experiences with the game.

先说缺点再说优点，仅个人观点！
记得去官网下载Ubisoft connect不然你是进不了游戏的！
缺点：

重复性任务：游戏中一些任务的设计可能显得有些重复，导致玩家在完成任务时感到单调。这可能对一些玩家的游戏体验造成一定的影响。
技术问题：尽管游戏在视觉和音效上非常出色，但有些玩家报告了一些技术问题，如帧率不稳定、卡顿和崩溃等。这些问题可能会影响游戏的流畅性和稳定性。
人物发展和情感联系：有些玩家认为游戏在人物发展和情感联系方面存在一些欠缺。他们希望能够更深入地了解主角和其他角色之间的关系，以及他们的成长和变化。
优点：

惊人的历史背景：大革命以法国大革命作为背景，这是一个充满戏剧性和历史意义的时期。游戏通过精心设计的任务和剧情，将玩家带入这段激动人心的历史中，让他们亲身体验到大革命的紧张气氛和人民的斗争。
精美的开放世界：游戏中的巴黎地图精细而生动，充满了历史建筑和繁华的街道。玩家可以自由探索这个开放世界，并参与各种任务和活动。开放世界的设计给玩家提供了无尽的可能性和乐趣。
流畅的战斗系统：大革命 的战斗系统非常出色，玩家可以运用各种刺客技能和武器，进行华丽而流畅的战斗。战斗场景充满了戏剧性和紧张感，让玩家感受到刺客的身份和使命。
视觉和音乐效果：游戏的视觉效果精美细致，呈现出了18世纪法国的壮丽景观。配乐恰到好处，营造出恢弘史诗般的氛围。这些视觉和音乐效果让玩家沉浸于游戏世界，增强了整体的游戏体验。
总体而言，大革命是一款令人难以抗拒的游戏，它在历史背景、开放世界设计、战斗系统以及视听效果方面都有着优秀之处。虽然存在一些缺点，但它的优点足以让玩家陶醉其中，尽情享受这段历史探险之旅。

I was surprised there were still some people in the online missions, but there are quite a bit, however most likely not in the missions you want to do, either way the people left are usually good players because they're most likely people that love the game, which make the online missions really fun in my opinion. As for the main game itself, its amazing, hands down the best parkour once you get used to it, and as everybody knows stealth is amazing,the story could be better though. The graphics are still amazing to this day and the map is very fun to play with even if you just run around,parkour and help citizens by assassinating your enemies. Now, the glitches, I haven't had any game-breaking glitch, and they certainly don't occur that often, and most of them are some slight graphical errors, but in comparison to the game's launch, the glitches barely show up and at the least so far for me they haven't really impacted my game at all. Unity is probably one of my favorite assassin's creed games now, and 100% one of the ones i have the most fun in. Highly recommended, but you should wait for a discount since the game is quite old now and depending on when you're reading this stuff like the online community may not be active at all, or the servers may shut down (don't worry though! you can still do the missions solo to get the rewards). Overall, very fun game, 9/10 because I'm sad I didn't play it when online was even more active.
Assassin's Creed: Oops! All Enemies!

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is.

⏰ How long to beat Assassin's Creed: Unity:
- Main Story - 17 Hours
- Main + Extras - 35 Hours
- Completionist - 70 Hours

⭕ - Conclusion -:

Assassins creed Unity is another incredible game in the assassins creed franchise. It offers a new location with a massive amount of collectables, story quests, side quests the lot. The other extra things this game offers include its online component which on release was a lot better than it is now although it is still playable. The story itself is okay but not the best I have ever played however still keeps you wanting more.

Assassin's Creed: Unity of Bugs

I wouldn't call it a bad game to be honest, but going to this after Black Flag just feels like a downgrade. 
I've tried to play it and I've experienced more bugs than I did in entirety of Cyberpunk 2077. 

Arno is cool, but dude, he just feels like budget Ezio and almost looks like him, story has been boring so far. It never got me hooked for long enough to care. 

Combat feels clunky, same with climbing and moving in general. I can't recall how many times I died cause for some reason he didn't jump into a haystack or a ledge. 

Arno's assassin suit looks pretty awful imo and no matter what I did, the suit always looked bad. 

I honestly doubt I'd bother with finishing this one - 4/10
THREE WORDS. UBISOFT LAUNCHER SUCKS!
Even if it can be frustrating, it is the last pure assassin game in the series. Although I'm hoping Mirage proves me wrong.

applist.name: Monster Hunter: World
applist.detailed_description:
Featured DLC


Featured DLC
























Digital Deluxe Edition


The digital deluxe edition includes the following content:

  • Samurai Set
    Layered armor sets will change the look of your armor without changing the properties underneath. Equip this Samurai set over your favorite armor to take on the striking appearance of a feudal Japanese samurai warrior!
    Note : No weapons are included with this set

  • Gesture: Zen
  • Gesture: Ninja Star
  • Gesture: Sumo Slap
    Enjoy three new amusing gestures you can use when interacting with other players in the game.

  • Sticker Set: MH All-Stars Set
  • Sticker Set: Sir Loin Set
    Fun stickers you can use when chatting with other players in the game.

  • Face Paint: Wyvern
    Add a new face paint for character customisation in Monster Hunter: World.

  • Hairstyle: Topknot
    Adds a new hairstyle for character customisation in Monster Hunter: World.


About the Game

Welcome to a new world! Take on the role of a hunter and slay ferocious monsters in a living, breathing ecosystem where you can use the landscape and its diverse inhabitants to get the upper hand. Hunt alone or in co-op with up to three other players, and use materials collected from fallen foes to craft new gear and take on even bigger, badder beasts!

INTRODUCTION

Overview
Battle gigantic monsters in epic locales.

As a hunter, you'll take on quests to hunt monsters in a variety of habitats.
Take down these monsters and receive materials that you can use to create stronger weapons and armor in order to hunt even more dangerous monsters.

In Monster Hunter: World, the latest installment in the series, you can enjoy the ultimate hunting experience, using everything at your disposal to hunt monsters in a new world teeming with surprises and excitement.


Setting
Once every decade, elder dragons trek across the sea to travel to the land known as the New World in a migration referred to as the Elder Crossing.

To get to the bottom of this mysterious phenomenon, the Guild has formed the Research Commission, dispatching them in large fleets to the New World.

As the Commission sends its Fifth Fleet in pursuit of the colossal elder dragon, Zorah Magdaros, one hunter is about to embark on a journey grander than anything they could have ever imagined.

ECOSYSTEM

A World That Breathes Life
There are various locations teeming with wildlife. Expeditions into these locales are bound to turn up interesting discoveries.

HUNTING

A Diverse Arsenal, and an Indispensable Partner
Your equipment will give you the power to need to carve out a place for yourself in the New World.

The Hunter's Arsenal
There are fourteen different weapons at the hunter's disposal, each with its own unique characteristics and attacks. Many hunters acquire proficiency in multiple types, while others prefer to attain mastery of one.


Scoutflies
Monster tracks, such as footprints and gashes, dot each locale. Your Scoutflies will remember the scent of a monster and guide you to other nearby tracks. And as you gather more tracks, the Scoutflies will give you even more information.


Slinger
The Slinger is an indispensable tool for a hunter, allowing you to arm yourself with stones and nuts that can be gathered from each locale.
From diversion tactics to creating shortcuts, the Slinger has a variety of uses, and allows you to hunt in new and interesting ways.


Specialized Tools
Specialized tools activate powerful effects for a limited amount of time, and up to two can be equipped at a time. Simple to use, they can be selected and activated just like any other item you take out on a hunt.


Palicoes
Palicoes are hunters' reliable comrades out in the field, specialized in a variety of offensive, defensive, and restorative support abilities.
The hunter's Palico joins the Fifth Fleet with pride, as much a bona fide member of the Commission as any other hunter.

reviews.review:
I've played this game for over 3 years and did not regret buying it a single time.
I found it immersive, this particular game's world may not offer some rich lore and what it does offer is mostly told by environment design, the combat requires a little bit of time getting used to if you've never played a MonHun game before, but I'd say it's worth it. Also huge thumbs up for amazing creature designs.
It's not flawless, far from it, but out of all the Monster Hunter games I've played so far this one I enjoyed the most. I highly recommend picking it up should you have a chance to do so, even 5 years after the premiere.
Game fun. Nuke monsters, use their bodies to make weapons, get your ass handed to you by an Ape that has achieved Super Saiyan 2. MonHun at its best.
When a game makes you realize you don't have friends to do hunts with, it's a good game.
Fury Rajang made me quit

My first [i]Monster Hunter[/i] experience.

Never did I play any [i]Monster Hunter[/i] series of any kind or tried them before [b]Monster Hunter: World[/b], and boy, am I missing out!

[u]Character creation[/u] is neat! I would like to see more customization, but that's just me and there are different types of gears to choose from for the right conditions and monsters. Many cosmetics and animations to select from and purchase for my desires. Cool and adorable!

[u]Gameplay[/u] could be tricky with the mouse and keyboard, but I prefer to play this on a game-pad since Monster Hunter is solely on consoles. Pairing up with other Hunters is bliss, and a handful of things to do as a team, making this experience an incredible journey in the [i]New World[/i]. A lot of grinding if you're looking for specific things.

The [u]Main Quest[/u] is engaging since you get to see the character you've created go through with the story and connect with the cast.

Overall, [i]Monster Hunter: World[/i] is a beautiful game to get the feels of the franchise and I was glad to stumble upon this as my first experience: I never knew I could outplay an ego "10-year veteran" (at the time of release) within a matter of days! Great person to learn the game from, but too prideful regarding "leadership."

I veteran now. *slowly nods*

I miss playing this game. Was the best MH experience I've had since MH: Tri on the Wii.

All I can say is that I hope the next installation of MH is a successor to World. Rise is good, but I just love this game. Iceborne is magical.
A game about hunting monsters and i'm addicted to it

Awesome game over all! --- [b] 9 / 10[/b]

You have to fight against some classic Monster Hunter monsters but also newer ones.

There are two questionable design choices btw:
- gathering hub fights against [spoiler] Kulve Taroth [/spoiler] and [spoiler] Safi'jiiva [/spoiler] (best be done with 16 players in a lobby)
- [spoiler] Alatreon´s [/spoiler] instant kill mechanic !!!
fantastic team play game
400+ on my PS4, its the GOAT
Still hate that monkey
I hate Lunastra with every inch of my frail white boy body
I think that this game is a godly game to play if you want to fight big bosses and you fight bosses all the time i mean it for me it the best game i every played in my live

Pros: It's Monster Hunter.

Cons: Somehow one of the worst coop experiences available in all of gaming (until the story is complete)

I am enjoying World a lot, but as someone who played Rise before World, I am going to point out some of the shortcomings of World comparatively, whilst still advising anyone else in that position to give World a go. World is paced more deliberately. Sometimes that can be good, other times it can be bad. Unfortunately it also extends to general QOL which Rise had. Why on earth you have to all watch unskippable cut-scenes separately in a game where co-op play should be encouraged is beyond me. I also dislike the way the long drawn-out tracking sequences function. Once again, it's okay when you're playing solo, but when you're trying to coop it's straight up "wait half an hour while I go pick up these footprints". "Tracking" a monster in itself isn't a bad idea, but I feel it should be a more interactive process going forward. As it stands, it just delays the story for an arbitrary amount of time and is designed to be completed passively whilst you grind gear. Why not give players the choice? Or make the tracking a team-based effort on a map? Just off the top of my head, Maybe the game could borrow ideas from Monster Hunter Stories 2, and have miniature locales branching off of the main map, "dens". Maybe a mini-game where you ultimately follow the trail to a den, where you could track down it's egg or some other precious item, leading to a confrontation with the monster.

Where World really shines is in all of the detail however. The things which the Nintendo Switch just does not allow for. The graphics are on the nose. But it's also smaller details like being able to capture a vast array of small creatures, then accommodate them at your house. Or, when you capture a monster and you can then see that monster sleeping in the village after the quest. It's little details like this which really elevate the game for me.

I am not yet in a position to comment on combat or gear. I have just completed Iceborne, using the Switch Axe. I used Dual Blades almost exclusively for 800 hours in Rise/Sunbreak, and a small amount of Hunting Horn. I will look to compare those weapons more directly once fully in the endgame.

I've been playing the Monster Hunter franchise since the first game released on the PS2. I missed a few games in between because I didn't have a 3DS, but I had been playing MHFU on my PSP up until World came out. 

World, in my opinion, is what Capcom wanted Monster Hunter to be back in 2004 but were limited by the hardware of the time. I loved the old games and have fond memories of playing them, but when I go back to play them I can only stomach the old systems for so long before I return to World. I've played some of Rise but it honestly felt like a step back from World.

All in all it is an amazing game with great mechanics and a wide variety of play styles to choose from. I have a few gripes like the "story" being shoe horned into the game and the frustrations it creates when trying to play multiplayer hunts if you're not on the same page in regards to reaching the specific cut-scenes. Other than that minor gripe this is by far my favorite Monster Hunter game of all time and my 1782hrs of game time will only continue to go up.

applist.name: DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT
applist.detailed_description:
Digital Deluxe Edition


The Deluxe Edition includes the game, a Cooking Item that gives your character permanent Ki-ATK and HP Stat boosts, and the Season Pass. The Season Pass adds 2 original episodes and a new story.


LEGENDARY EDITION


The Legendary Edition includes:
• Full game
• Season Pass (2 original episodes and a new story arc)
• Season Pass 2 (3 new story arcs)
• 2 Cooking Items that give your character temporary and permanent Stat boosts
• Tao Pai Pai Pillar


About the Game

BE THE HOPE OF THE UNIVERSE

• Experience the story of DRAGON BALL Z from epic events to light-hearted side quests, including never-before-seen story moments that answer some burning questions of DRAGON BALL lore for the first time!


• Play through iconic DRAGON BALL Z battles on a scale unlike any other. Fight across vast battlefields with destructible environments and experience epic boss battles against the most iconic foes (Raditz, Frieza, Cell etc…). Increase your power level through RPG mechanics and rise to the challenge!


• Don’t just fight as Z Fighters. Live like them! Fish, fly, eat, train, and battle your way through the DRAGON BALL Z sagas, making friends and building relationships with a massive cast of DRAGON BALL characters.

Relive the story of Goku and other Z Fighters in DRAGON BALL Z: KAKAROT! Beyond the epic battles, experience life in the DRAGON BALL Z world as you fight, fish, eat, and train with Goku, Gohan, Vegeta and others. Explore the new areas and adventures as you advance through the story and form powerful bonds with other heroes from the DRAGON BALL Z universe.

reviews.review:
Dragon Ball Z Kakarot is the dbz game I dreamed of as a kid. The game is amazing, truly the most impressive dbz game I have ever played. The gameplay is top notch it feels so fluid. The open world is perfect, there's tons of cool secrets to unfold. The game has a dope surprise if you defeat all the red enemies. The boss fights are solid. I played the first two DLC and they were pretty good although I expected more. Ill be coming back to play the other two DLC. Although the budokai games are special to me, I do have to say I think this is the best DBZ game I have ever played ! 
9/10 Amazing !!!!

[h1]Fantastic way to experience one of the most famous series in history.[/h1]
Includes all major plot points with far better graphics without some of the distracting fluff the original series had. That being said, it also includes some gameplay fluff that may be distracting but only if you let it.
For those that know nothing about Dragon Ball Z: This is an anime. Duh, right? So you can probably guess the graphics style. That being said, it is fully 3D and very well done- vastly improved upon the original series' graphics. Everything's in English, if wanted, and the storyline is a key feature of this game. You don't really need to know a whole lot about the series to enjoy this game. It is a fighting game, yes, but it feels more like a third person action RPG since there is a lot of character growth in levels, stats, and skills. I haven't beaten this game yet since I've let my son do more than half of the gaming hours I have put into it, but from what I've heard there is a lot of extensive character customization[spoiler[ after the game is won in a New Game+ fashion[/spoiler]. The fighting is very smooth and most of the time (hate it those few times whenever I can't interrupt my combo to dodge or block an attack) you can time things beautifully for a kickass experience. Fighting evolves throughout the game which is great if you want to compare it to Dragon Ball Xenoverse 2, which is basically the same combos the entire game and only super skills changing. Awoken skills, or transformations as they're called in this game, also make a difference in your fighting style which makes perfect sense. You are also able to, but not required to after the first tutorial bit, upgrade your stats and gains using a Community of characters that specialize in different things to provide you with various long-term passive bonuses of your choosing. It works using a mechanic that is similar to a gift/relationship system, but you can do it from anywhere and almost at any time.

The big complaint I have about this game: It's not cooking like people mention, it's not grinding for items like others mention in their reviews (if you don't like grinding then play on an easier difficulty so you don't have to, ya foo), it's that even though you've achieved the experience levels and orbs (orbs work like a specialized experience resource in this game) to upgrade a skill there are still many times in which you have to have a break-out battle to "train" for the skill in order to learn it and use it. This is made a little worse in the way that you can't progress further in that part of your skill tree at all unless you unlock that specific upgrade through the break-out battle (obviously you're required to win it) needed to unlock that skill. Gets annoying, especially when you're in a part of the game where it won't let you locate and use a training node. [strike]Also, even though the new skill is better in every way it doesn't automatically replace the older version of the skill? Maybe people just don't want to use more ki, w/e who cares.[/strike]
Definitely wait for when you have a controller you can play with, wish I would have known that before I bought the game.
the only downside for this game is that it has no multiplayer or 1v1
DBZ without fillers
Very fun game, dislike the random encounters though, feel like there are too many at times when I'm trying to get from point A to point B. But still love the game.
Awesome game if you love the story of Dragonball Z. Also it wasnt super difficult to get all the achievements for as well so thats an added bonus
Great game
OH BUT MY PRIDE GRRRR I WISH I WAS A CARROT
I Love Dragon Ball and this is such a good game if you haven't ever watched the series!

Should be Steamdeck certified, runs like a charm and you get 5 hours of battery life if not connected to a power cord so it is really well optimized. As for the game itself I don't know I barely played an hour.

applist.name: Monster Hunter World: Iceborne
applist.detailed_description:
Featured DLC
































About the Game

Monster Hunter World: Iceborne – a massive new expansion

“Explore the New World… and Beyond!“
Monster Hunter: World’s adventures reach new heights in “Monster Hunter World: Iceborne.”
With new monsters, new locales, new quests, new weapon combos, and so much more,
Iceborne expands the possibilities of Monster Hunter: World’s vast, breathtaking universe.

Join the Research Commission as they embark on an unforgettable adventure into the
depths of the Hoarfrost Reach, a snowy tundra that a host of legendary monsters call home.

Iceborne nearly DOUBLES the content from Monster Hunter: World
・New Monsters: The number of Large Monsters soars from 36 to over 66, with more coming in free updates!
・New Story: The number of Story Assignments jumps from 25 to over 50!
・New Locales: Explore the glacial landscapes of the Hoarfrost Reach!
・New Weapon Combos: Breathe new life into your combat with a series of brand-new attacks and combos
・New Armor: Suit up and customize your hunter with a wide variety of powerful armor skills!
・New Tools: Stack the odds in your favor with the revolutionary new Clutch Claw!
・New Headquarters: Group up and prepare for battle in the all-new social hub Seliana!
・New Difficulty: Test your mettle with the new quest difficulty Master Rank!
・New End Game: The journey never ends in the Guiding Lands!
…and much more!

The frozen frontier awaits…

Steam🄬 Version Features
-Uncapped Framerate
-High Resolution Texture Pack
-Graphical Optimization
-Ultrawide Display Support
-DirectX® 12 Support
-Improved Mouse & Keyboard Controls

reviews.review: Most of the negative reviews from 2020 are all patched and fixed now. The only thing you should be worried about is the difficulty curve and new mechanics coming from World to Iceborne but other than that, the game is fantastic and gives more content than base World.

Ignore the mixed overall reviews, as most of the negative reviews cover the DLC when it first came out, which had a tons of glitches/issues that have been fixed. Don't worry about the game-breaking glitches that are listed in the reviews, the game runs smoothly now, and rarely has performance issues. If you loved the base game, then you should definitely get Iceborne. It adds a new mechanic that is super fun to mess with and comes with more challenging monsters to fight. At this point, I honestly can't see the base game without the DLC, it is quite honestly the perfect match up in terms of addon content. Iceborne is a little bit pricey (POV base game is cheaper), but it is still worth the $40 although I would wait for a sale-

Certified hood classic. A lot of the negative reviews are from when the game released on PC. If it ever comes on sale and you even slightly liked the base game it's a must buy. It pretty much doubles the amount of playable content.

10 of 10 torture dlc for solo.
I can't solo progress because I got skill issue. 
+ Bazelgeuse is now friends 🤝 ,
- Banbaro is my new enemies 🦌

It's disheartening to see this DLC at a MIxed review score. I would have attributed that to the abysmal launch that has been fixed up since then, but I suppose there are still quirks to the DLC people don't like.
Personally, I love it. It adds another bump in challenge and offers plenty of new content that bolsters the gameplay loop of the base game. The base game honestly suffers from the lack of Iceborne since it give late game gear a good stepping stone into Iceborne's steep difficulty spike. 
Poor launch state aside, if you enjoyed your time with the base game, you'll love what Iceborne brings to the table.

more of monhun world but twice as tall and a lot more content

think of base game being the tutorial for iceborne

applist.name: Grand Theft Auto V
applist.detailed_description:
When a young street hustler, a retired bank robber and a terrifying psychopath find themselves entangled with some of the most frightening and deranged elements of the criminal underworld, the U.S. government and the entertainment industry, they must pull off a series of dangerous heists to survive in a ruthless city in which they can trust nobody, least of all each other.

Grand Theft Auto V for PC offers players the option to explore the award-winning world of Los Santos and Blaine County in resolutions of up to 4k and beyond, as well as the chance to experience the game running at 60 frames per second.

The game offers players a huge range of PC-specific customization options, including over 25 separate configurable settings for texture quality, shaders, tessellation, anti-aliasing and more, as well as support and extensive customization for mouse and keyboard controls. Additional options include a population density slider to control car and pedestrian traffic, as well as dual and triple monitor support, 3D compatibility, and plug-and-play controller support.

Grand Theft Auto V for PC also includes Grand Theft Auto Online, with support for 30 players and two spectators. Grand Theft Auto Online for PC will include all existing gameplay upgrades and Rockstar-created content released since the launch of Grand Theft Auto Online, including Heists and Adversary modes.

The PC version of Grand Theft Auto V and Grand Theft Auto Online features First Person Mode, giving players the chance to explore the incredibly detailed world of Los Santos and Blaine County in an entirely new way.

Grand Theft Auto V for PC also brings the debut of the Rockstar Editor, a powerful suite of creative tools to quickly and easily capture, edit and share game footage from within Grand Theft Auto V and Grand Theft Auto Online. The Rockstar Editor’s Director Mode allows players the ability to stage their own scenes using prominent story characters, pedestrians, and even animals to bring their vision to life. Along with advanced camera manipulation and editing effects including fast and slow motion, and an array of camera filters, players can add their own music using songs from GTAV radio stations, or dynamically control the intensity of the game’s score. Completed videos can be uploaded directly from the Rockstar Editor to YouTube and the Rockstar Games Social Club for easy sharing.

Soundtrack artists The Alchemist and Oh No return as hosts of the new radio station, The Lab FM. The station features new and exclusive music from the production duo based on and inspired by the game’s original soundtrack. Collaborating guest artists include Earl Sweatshirt, Freddie Gibbs, Little Dragon, Killer Mike, Sam Herring from Future Islands, and more. Players can also discover Los Santos and Blaine County while enjoying their own music through Self Radio, a new radio station that will host player-created custom soundtracks.

Special access content requires Rockstar Games Social Club account. Visit http://rockstargames.com/v/bonuscontent for details.

[Update]: For those wondering if I received the drinks, YES PEOPLE I GOT THEM!!, along with some chips too! It took a while to get the drinks because we're broke af, but hey, I got them few days later after I posted this. We never expected people to interact with this because the idea is just crazy, to our surprise it even exceeded our expectations. I also want to thank everybody for interacting and my friend for keeping his promise, I could never do it without you guys. We will never forget this legendary wholesome moment, maybe when I have the money, I should pay him back with some drinks.

(About the game it's really fun with friends especially when you have a lot of crazy things to do, Los Santos has brought me so many unforgettable memories)

Grand Theft Auto 5 is a masterpiece in the gaming industry. From the moment you start the game, you are completely immersed in a world that is rich with detail and possibility. The open world nature of the game is breathtaking, allowing you to explore and experience all the city has to offer. The game’s graphics are simply stunning, bringing to life the gritty city of Los Santos.

The gameplay in Grand Theft Auto 5 is incredibly dynamic and diverse. Whether you want to go on a crime spree, explore the city, or simply enjoy the nightlife, the game offers something for everyone. The story is also engaging and full of twists and turns that keep you on the edge of your seat.

One of the best aspects of Grand Theft Auto 5 is its replayability. With so many different options and choices to make, the game never feels repetitive or boring. Whether you want to play through the story again or try out new ways of exploring the city, there is always something new to discover.

The online component of Grand Theft Auto 5 is also exceptional. It allows you to play with friends and strangers in a massive online world that is filled with opportunities for both cooperative and competitive gameplay.

In conclusion, Grand Theft Auto 5 is a must-play game for anyone who enjoys open world, action-packed gaming experiences. It sets a new standard for what is possible in a game and offers endless hours of fun and excitement. If you haven’t played it yet, you are truly missing out on one of the greatest games of all time.
